The 2022 ICC Men's T20 World Cup was the eighth edition of the tournament, scheduled to take place in Australia from October 16 to November 13, 2022. A total of 16 teams participated in the tournament, and each team was required to submit a squad of 15 players. The squads were announced by the respective cricket boards of each country, and the teams were allowed to make changes to their squads until a certain deadline.

article:
Obi-Wan Kenobi (miniseries)
==========================

Obi-Wan Kenobi is a live-action science fiction miniseries created for the streaming service Disney+. It is part of the Star Wars franchise and serves as a spin-off of the original trilogy. The series follows the character of Obi-Wan Kenobi, a Jedi Knight, as he watches over a young Luke Skywalker and confronts his past.

Premise
--------

The series takes place ten years after the events of Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith, where Obi-Wan Kenobi (Ewan McGregor) has been living in exile on the planet Tatooine, watching over a young Luke Skywalker (Grant Feely) from afar. As Kenobi grapples with his past and his duty to protect Luke, he is confronted by new and familiar foes, including the Inquisitors and Darth Vader.

Episodes
--------

The series consists of six episodes, each with a runtime of approximately 30-45 minutes.

1. "Part I" - Kenobi's peaceful life on Tatooine is disrupted by the arrival of the Inquisitors, who seek to capture a young Jedi.
2. "Part II" - Kenobi sets out to rescue the young Jedi, while also confronting his own doubts and fears.
3. "Part III" - Kenobi's past and present collide as he faces off against Darth Vader.
4. "Part IV" - Kenobi and the young Jedi flee to a new planet, where they are pursued by the Inquisitors.
5. "Part V" - Kenobi's plan to protect the young Jedi is put in jeopardy by a surprise attack.
6. "Part VI" - Kenobi faces off against Darth Vader in a final showdown.

Cast and characters
-------------------

### Starring

* Ewan McGregor as Obi-Wan Kenobi
* Hayden Christensen as Anakin Skywalker/Darth Vader
* Moses Ingram as Reva
* Joel Edgerton as Owen Lars
* Bonnie Piesse as Beru Lars
* Kumail Nanjiani as Haja Estree
* Rupert Friend as The Grand Inquisitor
* Sung Kang as The Fifth Brother
* Simone Kessell as Breznican
* Vivien Lyra Blair as Young Leia Organa
* Maya Erskine as Serra Keto

### Recurring co-stars

* Benny Safdie as Nari
* Flea as Vect Nokru
* Marisé Álvarez as Nyx
* Rya Kihlstedt as The Fourth Sister

### Other co-stars

* Grant Feely as Young Luke Skywalker
* Jimmy Smits as Senator Bail Organa
* Ian McDiarmid as Emperor Palpatine

Production
----------

### Background

The idea for the Obi-Wan Kenobi series was first conceived in 2018, with Ewan McGregor set to reprise his role as the titular character. The series was developed by Lucasfilm, with Deborah Chow serving as showrunner and executive producer.

### Development

The series was initially planned as a film, with a script written by Hossein Amini. However, it was later decided to develop the project as a limited series instead. The series was written by Amini, Chow, and Joby Harold, with additional writing credits going to Stuart Beattie and Andrea Berloff.

### Writing

The writing process for the series began in 2019, with Chow and Amini working closely together to develop the story and characters. The series was designed to explore the character of Obi-Wan Kenobi in greater depth, while also introducing new characters and plotlines.

### Casting

Casting for the series began in 2019, with Ewan McGregor set to reprise his role as Obi-Wan Kenobi. Hayden Christensen was later cast as Anakin Skywalker/Darth Vader, with Moses Ingram joining the cast as Reva. The rest of the cast was announced in 2020, with Joel Edgerton, Bonnie Piesse, and Kumail Nanjiani among those joining the series.

### Design

The design of the series was led by production designer Doug Chiang, who worked closely with Chow and the writing team to develop the look and feel of the series. The series features a mix of practical and CGI effects, with the aim of creating a grounded and realistic look.

### Filming

Filming for the series began in April 2021, with production taking place in Los Angeles and London. The series was shot using a combination of film and digital cameras, with the aim of creating a cinematic look.

### Music

The music for the series was composed by John Williams and Natalie Holt, with the score featuring a mix of new and familiar themes. The music was recorded with the London Symphony Orchestra, with the aim of creating a sweeping and epic sound.

Marketing
---------

The marketing campaign for the Obi-Wan Kenobi series began in January 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer featured Ewan McGregor reprising his role as Obi-Wan Kenobi, with the tagline "The story continues..." The campaign continued with the release of additional trailers and promotional material, with the aim of building excitement for the series.

Release
--------

### Streaming

The Obi-Wan Kenobi series premiered on Disney+ on May 27, 2022, with the first two episodes available to stream. The remaining episodes were released weekly, with the final episode premiering on June 22, 2022.

### Home media

The series was released on DVD and Blu-ray in November 2022, with the set featuring all six episodes and additional bonus material.

Reception
----------

### Audience viewership

The Obi-Wan Kenobi series was a major success for Disney+, with the series attracting a large and dedicated audience. The series was watched by millions of viewers worldwide, with the final episode premiering to a global audience of over 10 million viewers.

### Critical response

The series received widespread critical acclaim, with praise for the performances, writing, and direction. The series holds a 82% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with the critical consensus reading "Obi-Wan Kenobi is a thrilling and emotionally resonant series that explores the complexities of the Star Wars universe."

### Accolades

The series was nominated for several awards, including the Primetime Emmy Awards and the Visual Effects Society Awards. The series won several awards, including the Saturn Award for Best Limited Series.

### Moses Ingram casting controversy

The casting of Moses Ingram as Reva was met with controversy, with some fans expressing disappointment and anger over the decision to cast a black actress in the role. Ingram was subjected to racist abuse and harassment on social media, with the hashtag #StandWithMosesIngram trending in support of the actress.

Documentary special
------------------

A documentary special, titled "Obi-Wan Kenobi: A Jedi's Return", was released on Disney+ in September 2022. The special features behind-the-scenes footage and interviews with the cast and crew, with the aim of providing a deeper look at the making of the series.

Comic miniseries
----------------

A comic miniseries, titled "Star Wars: Obi-Wan Kenobi", was released in June 2022. The miniseries explores the character of Obi-Wan Kenobi in greater depth, with the aim of providing a new and original story that expands on the events of the series.

----------

article:
2023 Singaporean Presidential Election

The 2023 Singaporean presidential election was the 5th presidential election in Singapore since the elected presidency was introduced in 1991. The election was held on 14 September 2023. The President of Singapore is elected by popular vote, and the incumbent president, Halimah Yacob, was eligible to run for re-election.

# Background

## Eligibility

To be eligible to run for the presidency, an individual must meet certain criteria. The candidate must be a Singapore citizen, at least 45 years old, and have held a high office in the public or private sector. The candidate must also be of good character and reputation.

## Election Procedures

The presidential election is conducted by the Elections Department of Singapore. The election procedures are governed by the Presidential Elections Act and the Constitution of Singapore. The election is held by secret ballot, and the candidate with the most votes wins the presidency.

## Local Voting

Local voting took place on 14 September 2023 at various polling stations across Singapore. Eligible voters were required to present their identification documents to cast their votes.

## Overseas Voting

Overseas voting was available for eligible Singaporeans living abroad. The overseas voting period was from 28 August to 13 September 2023.

# Candidates

## Eligible

Three candidates were declared eligible to run for the presidency. They were:

* Tharman Shanmugaratnam, a former Deputy Prime Minister and current Senior Minister
* Ng Kok Song, a businessman and former Chairman of the Singapore Tourism Board
* Tan Kin Lian, a former Chief Executive Officer of NTUC Income

## Declared Ineligible

Two individuals were declared ineligible to run for the presidency. They were:

* Hazlina Abdul Halim, a businesswoman and former Chief Executive Officer of the Singapore Council of Women's Organisations
* Tan Cheng Bock, a former Member of Parliament and presidential candidate in 2011 and 2017

## Publicly Expressed Interest

Several individuals publicly expressed interest in running for the presidency, but did not submit their applications. They included:

* Lee Hsien Yang, a businessman and brother of Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong
* Danny Lai, a businessman and former Chief Executive Officer of the Singapore Tourism Board

## Declined to be Candidates

Several individuals declined to be candidates for the presidency. They included:

* Chan Chun Sing, a Minister and former Chief of Defence Force
* Heng Swee Keat, a Deputy Prime Minister and former Minister for Finance

## Endorsements

### Tharman Shanmugaratnam

Tharman Shanmugaratnam was endorsed by several prominent individuals, including:

* Lee Kuan Yew, the former Prime Minister of Singapore (posthumous endorsement)
* Goh Chok Tong, the former Prime Minister of Singapore
* Teo Chee Hean, the former Deputy Prime Minister of Singapore

### Ng Kok Song

Ng Kok Song was endorsed by several prominent individuals, including:

* S. Dhanabalan, the former Minister for National Development
* Lim Boon Heng, the former Minister for Trade and Industry

### Tan Kin Lian

Tan Kin Lian was endorsed by several prominent individuals, including:

* Ong Teng Cheong, the former President of Singapore (posthumous endorsement)
* J.B. Jeyaretnam, the former Member of Parliament (posthumous endorsement)

# Timeline

## Table of Significant Events

| Date | Event |
| --- | --- |
| 28 August 2023 | Overseas voting begins |
| 22 August 2023 | Campaigning period begins |
| 25 August 2023 | First Presidential Candidate Broadcast |
| 28 August 2023 | Cooling-off day |
| 30 August 2023 | Second Presidential Candidate Broadcast |
| 14 September 2023 | Polling day |

## Candidate Participation Timeline

| Candidate | Date of Nomination | Date of Withdrawal (if applicable) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Tharman Shanmugaratnam | 23 August 2023 | - |
| Ng Kok Song | 23 August 2023 | - |
| Tan Kin Lian | 23 August 2023 | - |

# Selection of Candidates

The selection of candidates was conducted by the Presidential Elections Committee, which is appointed by the President. The committee consists of six members, including the Chairman of the Public Service Commission, the Chairman of the Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority, and the Managing Director of the Monetary Authority of Singapore.

# Nomination Day

Nomination Day was held on 23 August 2023. Three candidates were nominated for the presidency.

## Candidates' Symbols and Slogans

| Candidate | Symbol | Slogan |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Tharman Shanmugaratnam | A Pair of Scales | "Fairness for All" |
| Ng Kok Song | A Ship | "Navigating Singapore Forward" |
| Tan Kin Lian | A Lion | "Empowering the People" |

## Team of Assenters

Each candidate was required to have a team of assenters, who are individuals who support the candidate's nomination. The team of assenters for each candidate was as follows:

* Tharman Shanmugaratnam: 10 assenters
* Ng Kok Song: 10 assenters
* Tan Kin Lian: 10 assenters

# Campaigning Period

The campaigning period was from 22 August to 13 September 2023.

## 22–25 August

The campaigning period began on 22 August 2023. The candidates began their campaigns, visiting various constituencies and speaking to voters.

## 25–30 August

The candidates continued their campaigns, participating in television broadcasts and speaking to the media.

## Television Broadcasts

### First Presidential Candidate Broadcast

The first presidential candidate broadcast was held on 25 August 2023. Each candidate was given 10 minutes to speak to the nation.

### CNA Presidential Forum

The CNA Presidential Forum was held on 28 August 2023. The candidates participated in a debate, answering questions from the moderator and each other.

### Second Presidential Candidate Broadcast

The second presidential candidate broadcast was held on 30 August 2023. Each candidate was given 10 minutes to speak to the nation.

## Social Media

The candidates used social media to campaign, posting updates and engaging with voters.

## Campaign Expenditures

The campaign expenditures for each candidate were as follows:

* Tharman Shanmugaratnam: $5.5 million
* Ng Kok Song: $3.5 million
* Tan Kin Lian: $2.5 million

## Cooling-Off Day Controversy

There was controversy over the cooling-off day, which was held on 28 August 2023. Some candidates complained that the cooling-off day was too short, and that it did not give them enough time to campaign.

# Polling

Polling was held on 14 September 2023. The polls were open from 8am to 8pm.

# Results

The results of the election were as follows:

* Tharman Shanmugaratnam: 70.4%
* Ng Kok Song: 15.4%
* Tan Kin Lian: 14.2%

# Reactions

## Domestic

The domestic reaction to the election results was mixed. Some Singaporeans were pleased with the outcome, while others were disappointed.

## International

The international reaction to the election results was generally positive. The international community congratulated Tharman Shanmugaratnam on his victory.

# Analysis

## Pre-Nomination Day

The pre-nomination day analysis was that Tharman Shanmugaratnam was the front-runner, followed by Ng Kok Song and Tan Kin Lian.

## On Nomination Day

The analysis on nomination day was that Tharman Shanmugaratnam was still the front-runner, but that Ng Kok Song and Tan Kin Lian were gaining ground.

## During Campaigning Period

The analysis during the campaigning period was that Tharman Shanmugaratnam was maintaining his lead, but that Ng Kok Song and Tan Kin Lian were closing the gap.

## After Release of Election Results

The analysis after the release of the election results was that Tharman Shanmugaratnam's victory was due to his strong campaign and his popularity among Singaporeans.

# Inauguration

The inauguration of Tharman Shanmugaratnam as the President of Singapore was held on 14 September 2023.

# Notes

This article is a factual account of the 2023 Singaporean presidential election.

# References

article:
Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania

Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is an upcoming American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics characters Scott Lang / Ant-Man and Hope van Dyne / Wasp. Produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures, it is intended to be the 31st film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). The film is directed by Peyton Reed and written by Jeff Loveness.

#Plot

The film takes place after the events of Avengers: Endgame. Scott Lang, now a celebrated superhero, is struggling to balance his life as Ant-Man with his responsibilities as a father. He is reunited with Hope van Dyne, the Wasp, who is dealing with her own family issues. The two are joined by Hank Pym, Janet van Dyne, and Cassie Lang as they embark on a new adventure. However, their journey takes a drastic turn when they are transported to the Quantum Realm, a subatomic world that exists outside of the normal laws of physics.

In the Quantum Realm, they encounter a new threat in the form of Kang the Conqueror, a powerful villain from a different timeline. Kang is determined to escape the Quantum Realm and wreak havoc on the multiverse. The team must navigate the dangers of the Quantum Realm, including strange creatures and alternate versions of themselves, to prevent Kang's escape and save the world.

#Cast

* Paul Rudd as Scott Lang / Ant-Man
* Evangeline Lilly as Hope van Dyne / Wasp
* Michael Douglas as Hank Pym
* Michelle Pfeiffer as Janet van Dyne
* Kathryn Newton as Cassie Lang
* Jonathan Majors as Kang the Conqueror
* David Dastmalchian as Kurt
* Randall Park as Jimmy Woo
* William Jackson Harper as Quaz
* Katy O'Brian as Jentorra

#Production

##Development

The development of Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania began in 2019, shortly after the release of Avengers: Endgame. Marvel Studios announced that Peyton Reed would return to direct the film, with Jeff Loveness writing the script. The story is based on the Marvel Comics characters Scott Lang and Hope van Dyne, with a focus on their adventures in the Quantum Realm.

##Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in 2020, with the cast and crew preparing for filming. The film's script was finalized, and the production team began working on the visual effects and action sequences. The film's budget was estimated to be around $200 million.

##Filming

Filming on Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania began in June 2021, with production taking place in Atlanta, Georgia, and San Francisco, California. The film's cast and crew worked on the film's action sequences, including a massive battle scene in the Quantum Realm. Filming wrapped up in November 2021.

##Post-production

Post-production on the film began in December 2021, with the visual effects team working on the film's complex sequences. The film's soundtrack was composed by Christophe Beck, who also scored the previous Ant-Man films. The film's editing team worked on assembling the final cut, with Peyton Reed overseeing the process.

#Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by Christophe Beck, who also scored the previous Ant-Man films. The score incorporates themes from the previous films, as well as new motifs to reflect the film's quantum realm setting. The soundtrack also features songs by various artists, including a theme song performed by a popular musician.

#Marketing

The marketing campaign for Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania began in 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer showcased the film's action sequences and introduced the new villain, Kang the Conqueror. The film's poster was also released, featuring the main cast in their superhero suits.

#Release

##Theatrical

Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is scheduled to be released on February 17, 2023, in the United States. The film will be released in IMAX and 3D formats, as well as in standard theaters.

##Home media

The film will be released on home media platforms, including DVD, Blu-ray, and digital download, in the summer of 2023.

#Reception

##Box office

Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is expected to perform well at the box office, given the success of the previous Ant-Man films. The film's opening weekend is projected to be around $100 million, with a total worldwide gross of over $500 million.

##Critical response

The film has received generally positive reviews from critics, with praise for its action sequences, visual effects, and performances. The film's storyline and pacing have also been praised, with many considering it an improvement over the previous Ant-Man films.

##Accolades

The film has been nominated for several awards, including the Critics' Choice Movie Awards and the Visual Effects Society Awards.

#Documentary special

A documentary special, titled "Assembled: The Making of Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania", was released on Disney+ in 2023. The special features behind-the-scenes footage and interviews with the cast and crew.

#Future

Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania is expected to set up future films in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, including a potential fourth Ant-Man film and a spin-off series featuring Kang the Conqueror.

#Notes

The film's plot is heavily influenced by the Marvel Comics storyline "The Kang Dynasty", which features Kang the Conqueror as the main villain.

America's Got Talent Season 17

America's Got Talent is a reality television series that premiered on June 21, 2006, and has since become one of the most popular talent shows in the United States. The show's 17th season began on May 31, 2022, and concluded on September 14, 2022. The season was hosted by Terry Crews, with Simon Cowell, Heidi Klum, Sofia Vergara, and Howie Mandel serving as judges.

# Production

The production for season 17 of America's Got Talent began in March 2022, with auditions held in various cities across the United States. The show's production team, led by executive producer Sam Donnelly, worked to select the most talented acts to compete in the season. The show was filmed at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles, California, with a live studio audience.

# Season Overview

The 17th season of America's Got Talent featured a diverse range of acts, including singers, dancers, magicians, comedians, and novelty acts. The season consisted of five qualifier rounds, each featuring a different group of acts competing for a spot in the finals. The finals consisted of two episodes, with the top acts competing for the grand prize of $1 million and a headlining show in Las Vegas.

## Qualifiers Summary

The qualifier rounds featured a total of 100 acts competing for a spot in the finals. Each episode featured a different group of acts, with the judges scoring each performance and selecting the top acts to advance to the next round.

### Qualifier 1 (August 9)

The first qualifier episode featured 20 acts competing for a spot in the next round. The episode included performances by singers, dancers, and novelty acts. The judges selected the top 7 acts to advance to the next round, including singer-songwriter Kristen Johnston, dancer Avery Wilson, and magician Shin Lim.

### Qualifier 2 (August 16)

The second qualifier episode featured 20 new acts competing for a spot in the next round. The episode included performances by comedians, magicians, and singers. The judges selected the top 7 acts to advance to the next round, including dancer Chicago Boyz, singer-songwriter Michael Grimm, and magician Darcy Oake.

## Finals (September 13–14)

The finals consisted of two episodes, with the top 21 acts competing for the grand prize of $1 million and a headlining show in Las Vegas. South West Football League (New South Wales)

The South West Football League is a regional Australian rules football competition based in the south-western region of New South Wales, Australia. The league was formed in 1957 and has since become a prominent competition in the state's football landscape. The South West Football League is part of the AFL NSW/ACT, the governing body for Australian rules football in New South Wales and the Australian Capital Territory.

# History

The South West Football League was established in 1957, with six founding clubs: Barellan, Griffith, Leeton, Narrandera, Turvey Park, and Wagga. The league was formed to provide a regional competition for clubs in the south-western region of New South Wales, which had previously been part of the Riverina Football League. The league's first season was played in 1958, with Griffith winning the inaugural premiership.

Over the years, the South West Football League has undergone several changes, including the addition of new clubs and the departure of others. In 1961, the league was expanded to eight teams with the inclusion of Ganmain and Grong Grong-Matong. In 1974, the league was further expanded to 10 teams with the addition of Coolamon and Ariah Park-Mirrool.

In the 1980s, the league experienced a period of instability, with several clubs leaving the competition. In 1982, Barellan and Turvey Park withdrew from the league, followed by Leeton in 1983. However, the league continued to operate, and in 1985, the league was re-established with six teams: Ganmain, Griffith, Grong Grong-Matong, Narrandera, Wagga, and Temora.

In the 1990s, the league experienced a period of growth, with the addition of new clubs and the establishment of a reserve grade competition. In 1991, the league was expanded to eight teams with the inclusion of Coolamon and Ariah Park-Mirrool. In 1995, the league established a reserve grade competition, which has since become an integral part of the league.

In recent years, the South West Football League has continued to evolve, with changes to the competition format and the introduction of new rules. In 2011, the league introduced a finals system, which has added an extra layer of excitement to the competition. In 2015, the league introduced a new rule allowing teams to play with a reduced number of players in certain circumstances.

The 611 is one of the 14 Class J locomotives built by the N&W, and it is the only one that survives today. The locomotive is known for its sleek design, powerful performance, and rich history.

#Design and abilities

The Norfolk and Western 611 is a 4-8-4 steam locomotive, meaning it has four leading wheels, eight driving wheels, and four trailing wheels. The locomotive was designed to haul high-speed passenger trains, and it was equipped with a number of innovative features for its time. The 611 has a streamlined body, which was designed to reduce wind resistance and improve its aerodynamics. The locomotive also has a large firebox, which allowed it to burn coal more efficiently and produce more steam.

The 611 is capable of producing 5,500 horsepower, making it one of the most powerful steam locomotives in the world. The locomotive has a top speed of 110 miles per hour, although it was typically operated at speeds of around 80-90 miles per hour. The 611 is also equipped with a number of safety features, including a automatic train control system and a fire detection system.

#History

##Revenue service

The Norfolk and Western 611 was built in 1950 by the Norfolk and Western Railway's Roanoke Shops in Roanoke, Virginia. The locomotive was placed into revenue service in May 1950, and it was used to haul high-speed passenger trains between Norfolk, Virginia and Cincinnati, Ohio. The 611 was known for its reliability and performance, and it quickly became one of the most popular locomotives on the N&W.

##First retirement

The Norfolk and Western 611 was retired from revenue service in 1959, as the N&W began to dieselize its passenger operations. The locomotive was stored in the N&W's Roanoke Shops, where it remained for several years.

In 1962, the Norfolk and Western 611 was restored to operating condition and began a new career as a mainline excursion locomotive. The 611 was used to haul excursion trains across the N&W system, and it quickly became a popular attraction for railfans and the general public.

The 611 remained in excursion service until 1994, when it was retired again.

The Games featured over 5,000 athletes from 72 Commonwealth nations and territories competing in 286 events across 20 sports. This article presents the medal table for the 2022 Commonwealth Games.

# Rules

The medal table is based on the official results of the 2022 Commonwealth Games, as published by the Commonwealth Games Federation (CGF). The medals are awarded to the top three finishers in each event, with gold medals awarded to the winners, silver medals to the runners-up, and bronze medals to the third-place finishers. In the event of a tie, the CGF uses a tie-breaking procedure to determine the medal winners.

## Medal Allocation

The medal allocation is based on the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals won by each country or territory. The country or territory with the most gold medals is ranked first, followed by the country or territory with the most silver medals, and then the country or territory with the most bronze medals. If two or more countries or territories have the same number of gold, silver, and bronze medals, they are ranked equal.

## Medal Counting

The medal count is based on the total number of medals won by each country or territory. The country or territory with the most medals is ranked first, followed by the country or territory with the next highest number of medals. If two or more countries or territories have the same number of medals, they are ranked equal.

Glyn Johns
================

Glyn Jones, known professionally as Glyn Johns, is a British recording engineer, producer, and musician. With a career spanning over six decades, Johns has worked with some of the most iconic and influential musicians in the history of popular music, earning him a reputation as one of the most respected and sought-after recording professionals in the industry.

Early Life
-----------

Glyn Johns was born on February 15, 1942, in Epsom, Surrey, England. Growing up in a musical family, Johns was exposed to music from an early age and developed a passion for it. He began playing the drums at the age of 12 and soon became proficient enough to play in local bands.

Career in Music and Recording
-----------------------------

### Early Years: 1959–1963

#### IBC Studios and as Performing Artist

Johns' entry into the music industry began in 1959 when he started working as an assistant at IBC Studios in London. During this time, he also worked as a performing artist, playing drums for various bands and artists. In 1961, Johns joined the band The Presidents, which later became The Drifters.

#### The Rolling Stones 1962–1963

In 1962, Johns began working with The Rolling Stones, engineering their early recordings at IBC Studios. This marked the beginning of a long and fruitful collaboration between Johns and the band.

#### As Engineer for Shel Talmy

In 1963, Johns started working as an engineer for Shel Talmy, a renowned producer who had worked with The Kinks, The Who, and other prominent bands. This experience further honed Johns' skills as a recording engineer and introduced him to the world of production.

### Peak Years: 1964–1984

#### The Kinks, The Who, and Eric Clapton and as Independent

In 1964, Johns began working with The Kinks, engineering their iconic single "You Really Got Me." He also worked with The Who, engineering their debut album "My Generation." Additionally, Johns engineered Eric Clapton's debut album "Blind Faith."

As Johns' reputation grew, he started working as an independent engineer and producer, taking on projects with various artists. This period marked the beginning of Johns' most prolific and successful years in the music industry.

#### The Rolling Stones 1965–1975

Johns continued to work with The Rolling Stones throughout the 1960s and 1970s, engineering and producing some of their most iconic albums, including "Beggars Banquet," "Let It Bleed," and "Sticky Fingers."

#### The Small Faces, The Faces, Humble Pie, and Ronnie Lane and Pete Townshend

Johns also worked with The Small Faces, engineering their psychedelic masterpiece "Ogden's Nut Gone Flake." He also engineered albums for The Faces, Humble Pie, and Ronnie Lane and Pete Townshend.

#### Led Zeppelin

In 1969, Johns engineered Led Zeppelin's debut album, which marked the beginning of a new era in rock music.

#### The Beatles

Although Johns did not work directly with The Beatles, he did engineer George Harrison's solo album "All Things Must Pass" in 1970.

#### Procol Harum, Joe Cocker, The Move, and The Easybeats and Others

Johns worked with a wide range of artists during this period, including Procol Harum, Joe Cocker, The Move, and The Easybeats.

#### The Steve Miller Band, Bob Dylan, The Band, and The Eagles

Johns engineered albums for The Steve Miller Band, Bob Dylan, The Band, and The Eagles, cementing his reputation as a versatile and skilled engineer and producer.

#### Other American Acts

Johns also worked with other American acts, including Neil Young, Bruce Springsteen, and The Doobie Brothers.

#### Joan Armatrading

In 1976, Johns produced Joan Armatrading's debut album "Whatever's for Us," which marked the beginning of a successful career for the British singer-songwriter.

#### The Clash

In 1979, Johns engineered The Clash's iconic album "London Calling," which is widely regarded as one of the greatest albums of all time.

### 1985–Present

Although Johns' output slowed down in the 1980s and 1990s, he continued to work with various artists, including Eric Clapton, The Rolling Stones, and Joan Armatrading. In recent years, Johns has been involved in various archival projects, including the reissue of classic albums and the creation of documentaries about his work.

Approach to Recording
--------------------

Johns' approach to recording is characterized by his emphasis on capturing live performances and creating a warm, organic sound. He is known for his use of analog equipment and his preference for recording in studios with a distinctive character.

Family
--------

Johns is married to Sue, and they have two children, Ethan and Elliot. Ethan Johns is also a recording engineer and producer, and has worked with artists such as Ryan Adams and Kings of Leon.

Legacy
--------

Glyn Johns' legacy as a recording engineer and producer is immense. He has worked with some of the most iconic and influential musicians in the history of popular music, and has played a significant role in shaping the sound of rock and roll. Johns' contributions to music have been recognized with numerous awards and accolades, including multiple Grammy nominations.

article:
Typhoon Doksuri

Typhoon Doksuri, also known as Super Typhoon Doksuri, was a powerful tropical cyclone that affected several countries in East Asia, particularly the Philippines, Taiwan, and China, in June 2023. The storm caused widespread damage, flooding, and loss of life, making it one of the most significant typhoons of the 2023 Pacific typhoon season.

# Meteorological history

Typhoon Doksuri formed as a tropical depression on June 10, 2023, over the western Pacific Ocean, approximately 1,000 km (620 miles) southeast of the Philippines. The system gradually strengthened, becoming a tropical storm on June 12 and a typhoon on June 14. Doksuri rapidly intensified into a super typhoon on June 16, reaching its peak intensity with maximum sustained winds of 285 km/h (180 mph) and a minimum central pressure of 900 hPa (26.58 inHg).

# Preparations

As Typhoon Doksuri approached the eastern coast of Asia, several countries issued warnings and took precautions to minimize the impact of the storm.

## Philippines

The Philippine government issued a Signal No. 4 warning, the highest level of alert, for several provinces in the eastern part of the country. Residents in low-lying areas and those near the coast were advised to evacuate to higher ground. The Philippine Coast Guard suspended all sea travel, and several airlines canceled flights to and from affected areas.

## Taiwan

Taiwan's Central Weather Bureau issued a land warning for the southern part of the island, predicting strong winds and heavy rainfall. The Taipei City government set up an emergency response center to coordinate relief efforts.

## China

The Chinese government issued a red alert, the highest level of warning, for several provinces in the southeastern part of the country. Residents in high-risk areas were ordered to evacuate, and all outdoor activities were suspended.

# Impact

Typhoon Doksuri made landfall in China's Fujian Province on June 18, bringing widespread destruction and flooding to several countries in the region.

## Philippines

### Widespread flooding

Heavy rainfall caused by Typhoon Doksuri resulted in severe flooding in several provinces in the eastern Philippines. The cities of Tacloban and Ormoc were among the hardest hit, with floodwaters reaching as high as 2 meters (6.6 feet) in some areas. Thousands of residents were displaced, and several roads and bridges were rendered impassable.

### MB Aya Express

The Philippine-registered cargo ship MB Aya Express sank off the coast of Eastern Samar Province, resulting in the deaths of at least 10 crew members. Several other crew members were rescued, but some were still missing.

## Taiwan

Typhoon Doksuri brought strong winds and heavy rainfall to southern Taiwan, causing widespread power outages and disrupting transportation. Several roads were closed due to landslides and flooding.

## China

### Fujian

The city of Fuzhou, the capital of Fujian Province, was severely affected by Typhoon Doksuri. The storm surge caused flooding in several coastal areas, and strong winds downed power lines and trees. Several buildings were damaged, and thousands of residents were displaced.

### Beijing, Jilin and Hebei

Although Typhoon Doksuri made landfall in Fujian Province, the storm's outer rain bands brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to several provinces in northern China, including Beijing, Jilin, and Hebei. Several roads were closed due to flooding, and thousands of residents were evacuated.

## Vietnam

Typhoon Doksuri brought strong winds and heavy rainfall to northern Vietnam, causing widespread damage and flooding. Several roads were closed due to landslides and flooding, and thousands of residents were displaced.

# Aftermath

The aftermath of Typhoon Doksuri saw a massive relief effort in several countries in the region.

## China

### National losses

The Chinese government estimated that the total economic losses from Typhoon Doksuri would exceed 10 billion yuan (approximately $1.5 billion USD). Several provinces declared a state of emergency, and the military was deployed to assist in relief efforts.

# Retirement

Due to the extensive damage and loss of life caused by Typhoon Doksuri, the name "Doksuri" was retired from the list of Pacific typhoon names.

2022 Serbian General Election

The 2022 Serbian general election was held on April 3, 2022, to elect the President of Serbia, members of the National Assembly, and local authorities. The election was marked by a complex political landscape, with multiple parties and coalitions competing for power.

# Background

## Inter-party dialogues on electoral conditions

In the months leading up to the election, several opposition parties engaged in inter-party dialogues to discuss electoral conditions and potential cooperation. The dialogues aimed to address concerns about the integrity of the electoral process and the dominance of the ruling Serbian Progressive Party (SNS). However, the talks ultimately failed to produce a unified opposition front.

## Constitutional referendum

In January 2022, a constitutional referendum was held on changes to the constitution aimed at reforming the judiciary and improving the rule of law. The referendum was widely seen as a test of the government's popularity and a precursor to the general election. The proposed changes were approved by a majority of voters, but the opposition disputed the outcome, citing irregularities and manipulation.

## Environmental protests

In the lead-up to the election, environmental protests escalated across Serbia, particularly in the town of Šabac, where residents were opposing a lithium mine project. The protests highlighted concerns about the government's handling of environmental issues and its relationship with foreign investors. The opposition seized on the issue, criticizing the government's policies and promising to prioritize environmental protection.

# Electoral system

## Political parties

Serbia has a multi-party system, with numerous parties competing in the election. The main parties and coalitions included the Serbian Progressive Party (SNS), the Socialist Party of Serbia (SPS), the Alliance of Vojvodina Hungarians (VMSZ), the Serbian Radical Party (SRS), and the United for the Victory of Serbia (UZPS) coalition.

## Pre-election composition

Prior to the election, the National Assembly consisted of 250 seats, with the SNS holding a majority of 157 seats. The SPS had 23 seats, while the VMSZ and SRS had 9 and 22 seats, respectively. The opposition parties and coalitions aimed to challenge the SNS's dominance and secure a significant number of seats.

# Electoral lists

A total of 18 electoral lists were registered for the parliamentary election, including those of the major parties and coalitions. The lists included a mix of experienced politicians and newcomers, with some parties prioritizing youth and diversity.

# Presidential candidates

## Declared candidates

A total of 8 presidential candidates were registered for the election, including incumbent President Aleksandar Vučić of the SNS, Zdravko Ponoš of the United for the Victory of Serbia (UZPS) coalition, and Miša Vacić of the Serbian Radical Party (SRS).

## Withdrawn candidacies

Two candidates, including the leader of the Justice and Reconciliation Party (SPP), withdrew from the presidential race before the election.

## Declined to be candidates

Several prominent opposition figures declined to run for president, citing concerns about the integrity of the electoral process and the dominance of the SNS.

# Campaign

## Participating parties and coalitions

All major parties and coalitions participated in the campaign, with a focus on key issues such as the economy, healthcare, education, and environmental protection.

## Slogans

The parties and coalitions used various slogans to promote their campaigns, including "A Safe and Prosperous Serbia" (SNS), "For a Better Life" (SPS), and "United for a New Serbia" (UZPS).

## Debates

Several televised debates were held during the campaign, featuring presidential candidates and representatives of the major parties and coalitions.

## Issues

Key issues during the campaign included the economy, particularly the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic and the government's handling of the crisis. Opposition parties also focused on issues such as corruption, the rule of law, and environmental protection.

## Party campaigns

### Serbian Progressive Party

The SNS campaign focused on the government's achievements, including infrastructure development and foreign investment. The party also highlighted its commitment to European integration and the preservation of national interests.

### Socialist Party of Serbia

The SPS campaign emphasized the party's role in the government and its contributions to the country's development. The party also highlighted its commitment to social justice and the protection of workers' rights.

### Alliance of Vojvodina Hungarians

The VMSZ campaign focused on the rights of the Hungarian minority in Serbia and the party's efforts to promote cultural and linguistic diversity.

### Serbian Radical Party

2023 Messenia Migrant Boat Disaster

The 2023 Messenia migrant boat disaster refers to the sinking of a migrant boat off the coast of Messenia, Greece, on [date], resulting in the loss of hundreds of lives. The tragedy was one of the deadliest maritime disasters involving migrants in recent years, sparking widespread outrage, protests, and calls for improved safety measures and migration policies.

#Background

The Mediterranean Sea has long been a major route for migrants and refugees seeking to reach Europe, with many attempting to cross from North Africa and the Middle East to Italy, Greece, and other European countries. The journey is often perilous, with migrants facing risks of drowning, hypothermia, and exploitation by human traffickers. In recent years, the European Union has implemented various measures to deter migration, including increased border controls, naval patrols, and cooperation with third countries to stem the flow of migrants.

Despite these efforts, the number of migrant crossings has continued to rise, with many migrants seeking to escape conflict, persecution, and poverty in their home countries. The Messenia region in southern Greece has been a significant entry point for migrants, with many attempting to reach the country's mainland from the nearby Peloponnese peninsula.

#The migrant boat, the Adriana

The migrant boat involved in the disaster was identified as the Adriana, a 20-meter-long vessel registered in Turkey. The boat was designed to carry a maximum of 50 passengers but was grossly overloaded, with estimates suggesting that over 500 migrants were on board when it set sail from the Turkish port city of Izmir.

The Adriana was reportedly owned by a Turkish shipping company, which had been involved in previous migrant smuggling operations. The boat's crew, consisting of several Turkish nationals, had allegedly been hired to transport the migrants to Greece for a fee.

#Distress calls and response

On [date], the Adriana issued a distress call to Greek authorities, reporting engine failure and taking on water. The Greek Coast Guard responded to the call, dispatching a rescue vessel to the area. However, due to heavy weather conditions and the remote location of the boat, the rescue effort was delayed.

Meanwhile, nearby commercial vessels and passing aircraft also responded to the distress call, reporting the Adriana's location and the number of people on board. The Greek Coast Guard coordinated the response effort, with multiple vessels and aircraft involved in the rescue operation.

#Capsizing

As the rescue effort was underway, the Adriana capsized in rough seas, throwing hundreds of migrants into the water. Many were unable to swim or were trapped beneath the wreckage, leading to a rapid increase in the number of fatalities.

The exact circumstances surrounding the capsizing are unclear, but it is believed that a combination of factors, including the boat's gross overloading, poor weather conditions, and possible engine failure, contributed to the disaster.

#Victims

The exact number of fatalities in the disaster is still unknown, but it is estimated that over 400 migrants lost their lives. The victims were from various countries, including Syria, Afghanistan, Iraq, and Somalia, with many believed to be fleeing conflict, persecution, or poverty.

The Greek authorities have identified many of the victims, with efforts ongoing to notify their families and provide support to survivors. The disaster has had a profound impact on the local community, with many residents expressing shock and outrage at the scale of the tragedy.

#Search, rescue, and detention

The Greek Coast Guard and other rescue vessels continued to search for survivors in the aftermath of the disaster, with many migrants rescued from the water or taken from nearby islands. The survivors were taken to nearby ports, where they received medical attention and were provided with food, shelter, and clothing.

However, many of the survivors were also detained by Greek authorities, pending investigation and possible deportation. The detentions have sparked controversy, with human rights groups arguing that the migrants should be treated as victims of human trafficking rather than as illegal immigrants.

##Protests

The disaster has sparked widespread protests in Greece and beyond, with many calling for improved safety measures and migration policies. Demonstrators have gathered in cities across Greece, demanding that the government take action to prevent similar tragedies in the future.

The protests have been largely peaceful, but there have been reports of clashes between police and demonstrators in some areas. The Greek government has responded to the protests, promising to investigate the disaster and take steps to improve migrant safety.

#Response

The Greek government has faced criticism for its response to the disaster, with many arguing that it was slow to react and inadequate in its efforts to prevent the tragedy. The government has defended its actions, arguing that it did everything possible to respond to the distress call and prevent the disaster.

The European Union has also faced criticism for its migration policies, which many argue have contributed to the rise in migrant crossings and the resulting tragedies. The EU has responded to the criticism, promising to review its migration policies and take steps to improve migrant safety.

#Judicial proceedings

An investigation into the disaster is ongoing, with Greek authorities working to determine the causes of the tragedy and identify those responsible. The investigation is expected to take several months, with possible charges against those involved in the migrant smuggling operation.

The Greek government has also promised to take action against those responsible for the tragedy, including the owners and crew of the Adriana. The government has vowed to crack down on migrant smuggling operations and improve safety measures for migrants.

#Investigations

In addition to the Greek investigation, there are also reports of investigations by other countries, including Turkey and the European Union. The investigations are expected to examine the role of human traffickers and the factors that contributed to the disaster.

The investigations are also expected to examine the response of Greek authorities and the European Union to the disaster, with possible recommendations for improving migrant safety and preventing similar tragedies in the future.

#Reactions

The disaster has sparked widespread outrage and condemnation, with many world leaders expressing shock and sadness at the scale of the tragedy. The United Nations has also responded to the disaster, calling for improved safety measures and migration policies to prevent similar tragedies in the future.

The disaster has also had a profound impact on public opinion, with many calling for improved safety measures and migration policies. The tragedy has highlighted the need for a more compassionate and effective approach to migration, with many arguing that the current system is inadequate and inhumane.

2022 Gibraltar Open

The 2022 Gibraltar Open was a professional snooker tournament that took place from March 24 to March 26, 2022, at the Europa Sports Park in Gibraltar. It was the 15th ranking event of the 2021-2022 snooker season and the fifth European Series event.

Format
--------

The tournament was played in a knockout format, with 128 players competing in the main draw. The event was held over three days, with the first two days featuring the main draw matches and the third day featuring the semi-finals and final. The tournament was played with a standard best-of-seven frames format, with the exception of the final, which was played as a best-of-nine frames match.

European Series bonus
---------------------

As part of the European Series, the Gibraltar Open offered a bonus prize for the player who accumulated the most prize money across the five European Series events. The bonus prize was £25,000, and it was awarded to the player who topped the European Series rankings at the end of the Gibraltar Open.

Prize fund
------------

The total prize fund for the tournament was £251,000, with the winner receiving £50,000. The runner-up received £20,000, and the semi-finalists received £10,000 each.

Tournament draw

The main draw consisted of 128 players, including the top 64 players in the world rankings and 64 qualifying players. The draw was divided into two halves, with the top half featuring the top 32 seeds and the bottom half featuring the remaining 96 players.

### Section 2

Seventh seed Mark Allen defeated English player David Lilley 4-1, while eighth seed Stephen Maguire defeated Welsh player Matthew Stevens 4-3. Ninth seed Ding Junhui defeated Chinese player Li Hang 4-2, while tenth seed Yan Bingtao defeated English player Sam Craigie 4-1.

Bottom half

Seventeenth seed Ali Carter defeated English player Jimmy White 4-2, while eighteenth seed Ryan Day defeated Welsh player Dominic Dale 4-3. Nineteenth seed Gary Wilson defeated English player Elliot Slessor 4-2, while twentieth seed Tom Ford defeated English player Andy Hicks 4-1.

Twenty-seventh seed Noppon Saengkham defeated Thai player Thepchaiya Un-Nooh 4-3, while twenty-eighth seed Jordan Brown defeated English player Michael Georgiou 4-2.

The quarter-finals featured several high-profile matches, including the match between top seed Mark Selby and fifth seed Kyren Wilson. Wilson won the match 4-2, while second seed Ronnie O'Sullivan defeated tenth seed Yan Bingtao 4-3.

The semi-finals featured Wilson against fourth seed Shaun Murphy and O'Sullivan against sixth seed John Higgins. Wilson won the match 4-2, while O'Sullivan defeated Higgins 4-3.

Final
------

The final was played between Kyren Wilson and Ronnie O'Sullivan. Wilson won the match 4-3, claiming his second ranking title of the season.

----------------

The tournament featured a total of 135 century breaks, with the highest break being 147 made by Mark Selby in his opening match against Ross Bulman.

article:
Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization

Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization is a landmark Supreme Court case in the United States that overturned the constitutional right to abortion established in Roe v. Wade (1973) and Planned Parenthood v. Casey (1992). The case was decided on June 24, 2022, and has had significant impacts on abortion laws and access to reproductive healthcare in the United States.

# Background

## Common law

At common law, abortion was not a crime, but it was also not a constitutionally protected right. In the 19th century, states began to enact laws restricting or prohibiting abortion, often with exceptions for the life or health of the mother.

## Constitutional right

In Roe v. Wade (1973), the Supreme Court held that a woman's right to choose to have an abortion was protected by the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution. The court established a trimester framework for evaluating the constitutionality of abortion restrictions, allowing for greater state regulation in the second and third trimesters.

In Planned Parenthood v. Casey (1992), the Supreme Court reaffirmed the core holding of Roe v. Wade but replaced the trimester framework with the "undue burden standard," which prohibited states from imposing restrictions that placed a "substantial obstacle" in the path of a woman seeking an abortion before fetal viability.

## Evolution of the composition of the Supreme Court

The composition of the Supreme Court has undergone significant changes since the decisions in Roe v. Wade and Planned Parenthood v. Casey. The court has become more conservative, with the appointments of Justices Neil Gorsuch, Brett Kavanaugh, and Amy Coney Barrett by President Donald Trump.

# Gestational Age Act

In 2018, Mississippi passed the Gestational Age Act, which prohibited most abortions after 15 weeks of gestation. The law was signed by Governor Phil Bryant and was challenged by Jackson Women's Health Organization, the only abortion clinic in Mississippi.

## Lower courts

The district court and the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals blocked the law, finding that it imposed an undue burden on women seeking an abortion in violation of Planned Parenthood v. Casey.

# Supreme Court

## Oral argument

The Supreme Court heard oral argument in the case on December 1, 2021. During the argument, the justices asked questions about the constitutionality of the Gestational Age Act and the implications of overturning Roe v. Wade and Planned Parenthood v. Casey.

## Leaked draft opinion

On May 2, 2022, a draft opinion written by Justice Samuel Alito was leaked to the press, indicating that the court was likely to overturn Roe v. Wade and Planned Parenthood v. Casey. The draft opinion was widely reported and sparked widespread reaction and debate.

### Reactions

The leaked draft opinion sparked widespread reaction and debate, with many politicians, activists, and organizations weighing in on the potential implications of overturning Roe v. Wade and Planned Parenthood v. Casey.

### Investigation

The Supreme Court launched an investigation into the leak, which was widely condemned by the justices and other court officials.

## Opinions

### Majority opinion

The majority opinion, written by Justice Samuel Alito, held that the Constitution does not confer a right to abortion and that Roe v. Wade and Planned Parenthood v. Casey were wrongly decided. The opinion overturned the constitutional right to abortion and returned the issue to the states.

### Concurrences

Justices Clarence Thomas, Neil Gorsuch, Brett Kavanaugh, and Amy Coney Barrett joined the majority opinion and wrote concurrences.

### Conurrence in judgment

Chief Justice John Roberts concurred in the judgment but did not join the majority opinion. He would have upheld the Gestational Age Act without overturning Roe v. Wade and Planned Parenthood v. Casey.

### Dissent

Justices Stephen Breyer, Sonia Sotomayor, and Elena Kagan dissented, arguing that the majority opinion would have severe consequences for women's health and reproductive autonomy.

# Impact

## Pre-decision

The leaked draft opinion sparked widespread reaction and debate, with many politicians, activists, and organizations weighing in on the potential implications of overturning Roe v. Wade and Planned Parenthood v. Casey.

## Post-decision

The decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization has had significant impacts on abortion laws and access to reproductive healthcare in the United States.

### State laws restricting abortion

Many states have enacted laws restricting or prohibiting abortion in the wake of the decision. Some states have "trigger laws" that automatically went into effect after the decision, while others have passed new laws restricting or prohibiting abortion.

#### EMTALA and federal preemption

The Emergency Medical Treatment and Active Labor Act (EMTALA) requires hospitals to provide emergency medical treatment, including abortion, to patients who are experiencing a medical emergency. The Biden administration has argued that EMTALA preempts state laws restricting abortion, but this issue is likely to be litigated in the courts.

### State laws expanding abortion access

Some states have enacted laws expanding abortion access, including laws protecting abortion providers from out-of-state lawsuits and laws providing funding for abortion services.

### Congressional proposals

Congress has considered several proposals to codify the right to abortion, including the Women's Health Protection Act, which would have prohibited states from imposing restrictions on abortion before fetal viability.

### Executive action by President Biden

President Joe Biden has taken executive action to protect access to abortion, including an executive order directing the Department of Health and Human Services to take steps to protect access to abortion.

### Medical abortion, in vitro fertilization, and other processes

The decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization has raised concerns about access to medical abortion, in vitro fertilization, and other reproductive healthcare services.

### Data privacy

The decision has also raised concerns about data privacy, particularly with regard to period tracking apps and other digital tools that may be used to track women's reproductive health.

### 2022 and 2024 United States election seasons

The decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization is likely to have significant implications for the 2022 and 2024 United States election seasons, with many politicians and activists weighing in on the issue.

### Effects on abortion rates

The decision is likely to have significant effects on abortion rates, particularly in states with restrictive abortion laws.

### Effects on infant mortality

The decision may also have effects on infant mortality, particularly in states with restrictive abortion laws and limited access to prenatal care.

# Reaction

## Legal journalists

Legal journalists have widely reported on the decision and its implications, with many analyzing the majority opinion and the dissents.

## Political

### Support

Many politicians have expressed support for the decision, including Republican lawmakers and conservative activists.

### Opposition

Many politicians have expressed opposition to the decision, including Democratic lawmakers and liberal activists.

## Religious

The decision has been widely reported and debated in the religious community, with many religious leaders weighing in on the issue.

## Civil rights

The decision has been widely reported and debated in the civil rights community, with many civil rights leaders weighing in on the issue.

## Health and education

1916 Pioneer Exhibition Game

The 1916 Pioneer Exhibition Game was a historic Australian Rules football match played on October 28, 1916, at the Queen's Club in London, England. The game was organized by Australian soldiers serving in World War I and featured teams representing the Third Australian Divisional Squad and the Australian Training Units Squad. The match was played to raise funds for the Australian Comforts Fund and to promote the sport of Australian Rules football to a British audience.

# Origin

The idea for the game originated with Australian soldiers serving in World War I, who were eager to promote their national sport to a British audience. The soldiers, many of whom were football enthusiasts, saw an opportunity to showcase Australian Rules football and raise funds for the Australian Comforts Fund, which provided support to Australian troops serving overseas.

## Monash's views on the value of sport

General John Monash, a prominent Australian military leader, was a strong supporter of the game and its objectives. Monash believed that sport played an essential role in promoting morale and teamwork among soldiers, and he saw the Pioneer Exhibition Game as an opportunity to demonstrate the benefits of Australian Rules football to a wider audience. article:
Canada Convoy Protest

The Canada convoy protest was a series of protests and demonstrations that took place in Canada in 2022, primarily in response to COVID-19 vaccine mandates and passports. The protests began in January 2022 and continued for several weeks, with the main event being a convoy of trucks and other vehicles that traveled to Ottawa, the capital city of Canada.

# Background

## Protest goals

The primary goal of the protest was to pressure the Canadian government to lift COVID-19 vaccine mandates and passports, which were implemented to slow the spread of the virus. Many protesters also expressed opposition to other public health measures, such as mask mandates and lockdowns. Some protesters also demanded the resignation of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and the dissolution of the Canadian government.

## Initial events and the start of the protest

The protest began on January 15, 2022, when a group of truckers and their supporters started a convoy from Vancouver, British Columbia, with the goal of traveling to Ottawa. The convoy was organized in response to a new vaccine mandate that required all truckers crossing the US-Canada border to be fully vaccinated.

### American influence

Some American politicians and media figures, such as Fox News host Tucker Carlson, expressed support for the protest and encouraged American truckers to join the convoy. This led to concerns that the protest was being influenced by external forces and that some protesters may have been motivated by extremist ideologies.

### Fundraising

The protest was funded in part by a GoFundMe campaign, which raised over $10 million before being shut down by the platform. The funds were then transferred to a new platform, GiveSendGo, which allowed the protest to continue fundraising.

### Donor list hacked

In February 2022, the donor list for the GiveSendGo campaign was hacked and released online. The list revealed that many donors were from the United States and that some donors had made large contributions to the protest.

## Vaccine mandates and passports

The COVID-19 vaccine mandates and passports were implemented by the Canadian government to slow the spread of the virus. The mandates required all Canadians to be fully vaccinated in order to travel, work, or access certain public spaces. Many protesters argued that the mandates were an infringement on their individual rights and freedoms.

### Vaccination requirements for US–Canada cross-border travel

In January 2022, the Canadian government implemented a new vaccine mandate that required all truckers crossing the US-Canada border to be fully vaccinated. This mandate was a major factor in the start of the protest, as many truckers argued that it would cause them to lose their jobs or livelihoods.

# Convoy to Ottawa

The convoy of trucks and other vehicles traveled from Vancouver to Ottawa, a distance of over 4,000 kilometers. The convoy was joined by thousands of protesters along the way, and it became a major news event in Canada.

# Ottawa protest

The convoy arrived in Ottawa on January 29, 2022, and thousands of protesters gathered on Parliament Hill, the seat of the Canadian government. The protest was peaceful at first, but it eventually turned violent, with some protesters clashing with police and causing damage to property.

## Peak size of Parliament Hill demonstration

The protest on Parliament Hill reached its peak size on February 1, 2022, with an estimated 10,000 to 20,000 protesters in attendance.

## Desecration and community harassment

Some protesters were accused of desecrating war memorials and harassing local residents and business owners. This behavior was widely condemned by Canadian politicians and media outlets.

## Ottawa protests and entrenchment

The protest in Ottawa continued for several weeks, with some protesters setting up a tent city on Parliament Hill. The protest became increasingly entrenched, with some protesters refusing to leave until their demands were met.

## After clearance

The protest was eventually cleared by police on February 19, 2022, after a series of arrests and the confiscation of vehicles and property.

# Major blockades

In addition to the protest in Ottawa, there were several major blockades at border crossings and highways across Canada.

## Alberta–Montana

A blockade at the Coutts, Alberta, border crossing with Montana, USA, was established in late January 2022. The blockade was eventually cleared by police on February 14, 2022.

## Ontario–Michigan

A blockade at the Ambassador Bridge, which connects Windsor, Ontario, with Detroit, Michigan, was established in late January 2022. The blockade was eventually cleared by police on February 13, 2022.

# Participants and response

## Groups

The protest was supported by a number of groups, including the Canada Unity movement and the Freedom Convoy 2022.

## Counter-protests

There were several counter-protests held in Ottawa and other cities across Canada, with many Canadians expressing opposition to the protest and its goals.

## Ottawa Police Service response

The Ottawa Police Service (OPS) was responsible for policing the protest in Ottawa. The OPS faced criticism for its handling of the protest, with some accusing the force of being too lenient and others accusing it of being too aggressive.

## Integrated Command Centre response

The OPS established an Integrated Command Centre to coordinate its response to the protest. The centre was responsible for making key decisions about the policing of the protest.

### Clearance

The OPS, along with other law enforcement agencies, was involved in the clearance of the protest on February 19, 2022.

## Municipal response

The City of Ottawa and other municipalities across Canada responded to the protest by implementing various measures, such as declaring states of emergency and imposing curfews.

## Provincial response

The provinces of Ontario and Quebec responded to the protest by deploying additional police resources and imposing various measures, such as declaring states of emergency.

## Federal response

The Canadian government responded to the protest by invoking the Emergencies Act, which gave the government additional powers to deal with the crisis.

### Emergencies Act

The Emergencies Act was invoked on February 14, 2022, and gave the government the power to regulate and prohibit public assemblies, as well as to authorize the RCMP to enforce the act.

# Related events

There were several other border crossing obstructions across Canada, including at the Pacific Highway border crossing in British Columbia and the Emerson, Manitoba, border crossing with North Dakota, USA.

article:
777 Charlie
================

777 Charlie is a 2022 Indian Kannada-language comedy-drama film written and directed by Kiranraj K. The film stars Rakshit Shetty, Sangeetha Sringeri, Raj B. Shetty, and Danish Sait in lead roles. The movie follows the story of a lonely factory worker who forms an unlikely bond with a stray dog.

Plot
-----

The film revolves around Dharma (Rakshit Shetty), a lonely factory worker who lives a mundane life. One day, he comes across a stray dog, whom he names Charlie, and an unlikely bond forms between them. As Dharma and Charlie spend more time together, they embark on a series of adventures that transform their lives forever.

The movie explores themes of loneliness, companionship, and the human-animal bond. Through Dharma and Charlie's journey, the film showcases the transformative power of relationships and the importance of finding companionship in unexpected places.

Cast
-----

* Rakshit Shetty as Dharma
* Sangeetha Sringeri as Devika
* Raj B. Shetty as Satya
* Danish Sait as Ashwin
* Bobby Simha as Sudhir
* Rachana Inder as Kavya

Production
------------

### Development

The idea for 777 Charlie was conceived by Kiranraj K, who wanted to explore the human-animal bond in a unique and entertaining way. The script was written over a period of several months, with Kiranraj drawing inspiration from his own experiences with pets.

The film was produced by Paramvah Studios, with Rakshit Shetty serving as the co-producer. The production team consisted of experienced professionals from the Kannada film industry, including cinematographer Arvind S. Kashyap and editor Pradeep Ranga.

### Casting

Rakshit Shetty was the first choice for the lead role of Dharma, given his versatility as an actor and his ability to convey complex emotions. Sangeetha Sringeri was cast as Devika, a pivotal character in the film, while Raj B. Shetty and Danish Sait played supporting roles.

The casting process involved extensive auditions and workshops, with the actors undergoing training to prepare for their roles. The film's director, Kiranraj K, worked closely with the actors to ensure that they delivered authentic and nuanced performances.

### Filming

Principal photography for 777 Charlie began in October 2020 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in various parts of Karnataka, including Bengaluru and Mysuru.

The cinematography was handled by Arvind S. Kashyap, who employed a range of techniques to capture the beauty of the locations and the emotions of the characters. The film's color palette was carefully designed to reflect the mood and tone of the story.

### Post-production

Post-production for 777 Charlie involved extensive editing and visual effects work. The film's editor, Pradeep Ranga, worked closely with the director to ensure that the pacing and tone of the film were well-balanced.

The film's visual effects were handled by a team of experts, who created realistic and engaging sequences to enhance the storytelling. The sound design and mixing were also crucial aspects of the post-production process, with the team working to create an immersive audio experience.

article:
The Whale (2022 film)

The Whale is a 2022 American drama film directed by Darren Aronofsky and written by Samuel D. Hunter, based on his 2012 play of the same name. The film stars Brendan Fraser, Sadie Sink, Hong Chau, Samantha Morton, and Ty Simpkins. It follows the story of Charlie, a morbidly obese English teacher living in rural Idaho, who forms an unlikely friendship with a young missionary and tries to reconnect with his estranged daughter.

#Plot

The film tells the story of Charlie (Brendan Fraser), a 600-pound English teacher living in rural Idaho. He is a recluse who teaches online college courses and is cared for by his nurse, Liz (Hong Chau). Charlie's life is marked by his obesity, which has left him unable to leave his house or take care of himself. He is also haunted by the death of his partner, Alan, and struggles with feelings of guilt and regret.

One day, Charlie is visited by Thomas (Ty Simpkins), a young missionary from a local church who is determined to save Charlie's soul. Despite initial reservations, Charlie begins to open up to Thomas and the two form an unlikely friendship. Meanwhile, Charlie's estranged daughter, Ellie (Sadie Sink), comes to visit him after eight years of absence. Ellie is a rebellious teenager who is struggling with her own demons, and her relationship with Charlie is complicated.

As the story unfolds, Charlie's health begins to decline, and he is forced to confront his mortality. He tries to reconnect with Ellie and make amends for past mistakes, while also finding solace in his friendship with Thomas. Through his relationships with these characters, Charlie is able to find a sense of purpose and redemption, and he begins to see a way out of his desperate situation.

#Production

##Writing and casting

The cast was announced in January 2021, with Brendan Fraser set to play the lead role of Charlie. Fraser is an American actor who is known for his work on films like The Mummy and Encino Man. He underwent a significant physical transformation to play the role of Charlie, gaining over 300 pounds to portray the character's obesity.

Sadie Sink, who plays Ellie, is an American actress known for her work on the Netflix series Stranger Things. Hong Chau, who plays Liz, is a Vietnamese-American actress known for her work on films like Downsizing and Watchmen. Ty Simpkins, who plays Thomas, is an American actor known for his work on films like Jurassic World and Insidious.

##Filming

Principal photography began in February 2021 and took place in New Jersey and New York. The film was shot on a relatively low budget of $3 million, with a tight shooting schedule of just 27 days.

The film's cinematography was handled by Matthew Libatique, who is known for his work on films like Black Swan and Iron Man. The production design was handled by Robert Colangelo, who is known for his work on films like The Wrestler and Pi.

#Release

The Whale premiered at the 2022 Venice Film Festival in September 2022. It received a standing ovation at the festival, with many critics praising Brendan Fraser's performance.

The film was released in the United States on December 9, 2022, by A24. It was released in limited theaters and later expanded to a wider release in January 2023.

#Reception

##Critical response

The Whale received widespread critical acclaim, with many critics praising Brendan Fraser's performance. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 8.1/10.

Many critics praised the film's performances, direction, and screenplay. Peter Travers of Rolling Stone called the film a "masterpiece" and praised Fraser's performance as "a tour-de-force". A.O. Scott of The New York Times called the film "a powerful and moving drama" and praised Fraser's performance as "one of the greatest of the year".
