article:
Martin Amis

Martin Amis is a British novelist, essayist, memoirist, and screenwriter. He is known for his bold, inventive, and often provocative writing style, which has been praised for its wit, intelligence, and emotional depth. Throughout his career, Amis has explored a wide range of themes, including the human condition, politics, culture, and morality.

#Early life

Martin Amis was born on August 25, 1949, in Oxford, England, to Kingsley Amis, a novelist and poet, and Elizabeth Jane Howard, a novelist. He is the eldest of three brothers, including Philip Amis and Jamie Amis. Amis's parents divorced in 1963, and he spent much of his childhood moving between his parents' homes in England and the United States.

Amis was educated at several schools, including St John's College, Cambridge, where he read English Literature. During his time at Cambridge, Amis developed a passion for writing and began to write short stories and poetry. After graduating, he worked as a literary editor and freelance writer, contributing to various publications, including The Times Literary Supplement and The New Statesman.

#Early writing

Amis's early writing was heavily influenced by his father's work, as well as the literary movements of the 1960s and 1970s. His first novel, "The Rachel Papers," was published in 1973 to critical acclaim. The novel follows the story of a young man's obsessive relationship with a woman and explores themes of love, sex, and identity.

Amis's subsequent novels, including "Dead Babies" (1975) and "Success" (1978), continued to explore themes of relationships, identity, and morality. These novels established Amis as a rising star in the literary world and earned him a reputation for his bold and innovative writing style.

#Main career

##1980s and 1990s

The 1980s and 1990s saw Amis's career reach new heights. His novel "Money: A Suicide Note" (1984) was a major success, and its exploration of greed, excess, and the corrupting influence of wealth resonated with readers. The novel was shortlisted for the Booker Prize and cemented Amis's reputation as a major literary talent.

Amis's subsequent novels, including "London Fields" (1989) and "Time's Arrow" (1991), continued to explore themes of identity, morality, and the human condition. "London Fields" was a postmodern epic that explored the intersection of politics, culture, and personal relationships, while "Time's Arrow" was a novel that told the story of the Holocaust in reverse.

##2000s

The 2000s saw Amis's career continue to evolve. His novel "Yellow Dog" (2003) was a major success, and its exploration of celebrity culture, identity, and morality resonated with readers. The novel was shortlisted for the Booker Prize and cemented Amis's reputation as a major literary talent.

Amis's subsequent novels, including "House of Meetings" (2006) and "The Pregnant Widow" (2010), continued to explore themes of identity, morality, and the human condition. "House of Meetings" was a novel that explored the intersection of politics, culture, and personal relationships, while "The Pregnant Widow" was a novel that explored the complexities of human relationships and identity.

##2010s and 2020s

The 2010s and 2020s saw Amis's career continue to evolve. His novel "Lionel Asbo: State of England" (2012) was a major success, and its exploration of class, identity, and morality resonated with readers. The novel was shortlisted for the Booker Prize and cemented Amis's reputation as a major literary talent.

Amis's subsequent novels, including "The Zone of Interest" (2014) and "Inside Story" (2020), continued to explore themes of identity, morality, and the human condition. "The Zone of Interest" was a novel that explored the intersection of politics, culture, and personal relationships, while "Inside Story" was a novel that explored the complexities of human relationships and identity.

##Other work

In addition to his novels, Amis has also written several works of non-fiction, including "Visiting Mrs Nabokov" (1993) and "Experience" (2000). These works have explored themes of literature, culture, and personal identity.

Amis has also written several screenplays, including "Saturn 3" (1980) and "Mars Attacks!" (1996). These screenplays have explored themes of science fiction, horror, and comedy.

###University of Manchester

In 2011, Amis was appointed as a professor of creative writing at the University of Manchester. He has taught several courses on literature and writing and has supervised several doctoral students.

#Personal life

Amis has been married twice, first to Antonia Phillips from 1984 to 1996, and then to Isabel Fonseca in 1998. He has two daughters, Delilah and Fernanda, and a son, Louis.

##Death

Amis's death was announced on May 22, 2023, after a long battle with esophageal cancer. He was 73 years old.

#Views

Amis has been known for his outspoken views on literature, politics, and culture.

##Writing

Amis has been a vocal advocate for the importance of literature and writing. He has argued that writing is a vital part of human expression and that it has the power to shape our understanding of the world.

##Nuclear proliferation

Amis has been a vocal critic of nuclear proliferation. He has argued that the spread of nuclear weapons is a major threat to global security and that it must be stopped.

##Geopolitics

Amis has been a vocal commentator on geopolitics. He has argued that the world is a complex and interconnected place and that we must understand these complexities in order to navigate the challenges of the 21st century.

##Electoral politics

Amis has been a vocal critic of electoral politics. He has argued that the current system is flawed and that it must be reformed in order to truly represent the will of the people.

##Islam and Islamism

Amis has been a vocal commentator on Islam and Islamism. He has argued that Islamism is a major threat to global security and that it must be confronted.

##Euthanasia

Amis has been a vocal advocate for euthanasia. He has argued that individuals have the right to choose their own death and that this right must be respected.

##Agnosticism

Amis has been a vocal advocate for agnosticism. He has argued that we cannot know for certain whether God exists or not and that we must approach this question with humility and skepticism.

2023 Pacific Typhoon Season

The 2023 Pacific typhoon season is the current annual tropical cyclone season in the western Pacific Ocean. The season runs throughout 2023, though most tropical cyclones typically develop between May and October. The season's first named storm, Amang, formed on January 2, 2023.

# Seasonal forecasts

Several national meteorological agencies and scientific institutions forecast how many tropical cyclones will form during a season and/or how many will reach tropical storm or typhoon strength. These agencies include the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA), the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA), and the Tropical Meteorology Department of the National Meteorological Center of China (NMCC). These forecasts are subject to change as the season progresses.

# Seasonal summary

## Early season activity

The season's first named storm, Tropical Depression Amang, formed on January 2, 2023. The storm made landfall in the Philippines, causing minimal damage and casualties. In the following weeks, a few more tropical depressions formed, but none of them intensified into named storms.

## Peak season activity

As the season progressed, the number of tropical cyclones forming in the western Pacific increased. In July, a series of intense typhoons formed, including Mawar, Guchol, and Doksuri. These storms brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to several countries in Southeast Asia, resulting in significant damage and loss of life.

## Late season activity

In the latter part of the season, the number of tropical cyclones began to decrease. However, a few storms still formed, including Typhoon Lan, which brought strong winds and heavy rainfall to Japan in October.

# Systems

## Tropical Depression Amang

Tropical Depression Amang formed on January 2, 2023. The storm made landfall in the Philippines, causing minimal damage and casualties.

## Tropical Storm Sanvu

Tropical Storm Sanvu formed on January 12, 2023. The storm moved northwestward and dissipated without affecting any landmass.

Typhoon Mawar formed on June 30, 2023. The storm intensified into a category 4 typhoon and made landfall in China, causing significant damage and loss of life.

Typhoon Khanun formed on July 17, 2023. The storm intensified into a category 5 typhoon and moved northwestward, affecting several countries in Southeast Asia.

## Typhoon Lan

Typhoon Lan formed on October 10, 2023. The storm intensified into a category 3 typhoon and made landfall in Japan, causing significant damage and loss of life.

## Typhoon Dora

Typhoon Dora formed on October 15, 2023. The storm intensified into a category 4 typhoon and moved northwestward, affecting several countries in Southeast Asia.

article:
Elemental (2023 film)

Elemental is a 2023 American computer-animated fantasy adventure film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and released by Walt Disney Pictures. The film is directed by Peter Sohn and written by Sohn, Denise Ream, and Dan Scanlon. Elemental takes place in a world where the four elements - fire, water, earth, and air - are inhabited by elemental beings with the ability to control their respective elements.

#Plot

In a world where the elements are alive, a young fire elemental named Ember lives in a bustling city called Firetown, where fire elementals live and work together. Ember dreams of exploring the world beyond her city, but her plans are put on hold when she meets Wade, a water elemental from the city of Watertown. The two elementals come from different worlds and have different approaches to life, but they quickly form a bond.

As Ember and Wade spend more time together, they realize that their differences are what make their relationship special. However, their love is put to the test when a natural disaster threatens the balance of the elements, and they must work together to save their world. Along the way, they meet other elementals, including a wise old earth elemental named Bernie and a free-spirited air elemental named Brook.

#Voice cast

* Leah Lewis as Ember, a young fire elemental
* Mamoudou Athie as Wade, a water elemental
* Ronnie del Carmen as Bernie, an earth elemental
* Shila Ommi as Brook, an air elemental
* Wendi McLendon-Covey as Gale, a fire elemental and Ember's mother
* Catherine O'Hara as Brook's mother, an air elemental

#Production

##Development

Elemental was first announced in May 2020, with Peter Sohn set to direct and Denise Ream producing. The film was initially scheduled for release in 2022, but was later pushed back to 2023 due to production delays.

##Writing

The screenplay was written by Sohn, Ream, and Dan Scanlon. The writers drew inspiration from their own experiences with relationships and the natural world. Sohn has stated that he wanted to create a film that celebrated the beauty of the elements and the diversity of the world around us.

##Casting

The voice cast was announced in July 2022, with Leah Lewis and Mamoudou Athie set to star as Ember and Wade. The cast also includes Ronnie del Carmen, Shila Ommi, Wendi McLendon-Covey, and Catherine O'Hara.

##Inspiration

The film's world and characters were inspired by a variety of sources, including the natural world, mythology, and fantasy literature. Sohn has stated that he was particularly inspired by the works of Hayao Miyazaki and the Studio Ghibli films.

##Animation and design

The animation was produced by Pixar Animation Studios, with a team of over 500 artists and technicians working on the film. The film's design was inspired by a variety of styles, including traditional animation, computer-generated imagery, and live-action cinematography. The film's color palette was designed to reflect the natural world, with a focus on earth tones and vibrant colors.

#Music

The film's score was composed by Thomas Newman, with a soundtrack featuring a mix of orchestral and choral pieces. The soundtrack also includes several original songs, including "Elemental," which was performed by Lewis and Athie.

#Release

##Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in January 2023, with the release of the first trailer. The trailer was widely shared on social media, with many fans expressing their excitement for the film. The film's marketing campaign also included a series of promotional partnerships, including a partnership with the National Park Service.

##Streaming and home media

Elemental was released in theaters on June 16, 2023, and was later made available on Disney+ and Blu-ray. The film's home media release included a number of bonus features, including a making-of documentary and several deleted scenes.

#Reception

##Box office

Elemental was a commercial success, grossing over $400 million worldwide. The film opened at number one at the box office, with a opening weekend gross of over $60 million.

##Critical response

The film received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's animation, characters, and storyline. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 8.1/10.

##Accolades

Elemental has received several awards and nominations, including an Academy Award nomination for Best Animated Feature. The film also won several Annie Awards, including Best Animated Feature and Best Directing.

#Notes

Elemental is the 20th feature film produced by Pixar Animation Studios. The film's world and characters are inspired by a variety of sources, including the natural world, mythology, and fantasy literature.

article:
2022 United States Infant Formula Shortage

The 2022 United States infant formula shortage was a widespread scarcity of infant formula in the United States that began in 2022. The shortage was caused by a combination of factors, including supply chain issues, a recall and plant shutdown, import restrictions, and market concentration. The shortage had significant effects on families and caregivers of infants, leading to increased prices, reduced availability, and alternative feeding methods.

#Causes

The 2022 United States infant formula shortage was caused by a combination of factors that affected the supply and availability of infant formula.

##Supply chain issues

Supply chain issues, including shortages of raw materials and transportation disruptions, contributed to the infant formula shortage. The COVID-19 pandemic had already strained global supply chains, and the formula shortage was further exacerbated by these issues.

##Recall and plant shutdown

A recall and plant shutdown at the Abbott Nutrition plant in Sturgis, Michigan, was a significant contributor to the infant formula shortage. The plant was shut down in February 2022 due to concerns over bacterial contamination, including Cronobacter sakazakii.

###Alleged problems at Sturgis plant

Allegations of problems at the Sturgis plant, including unsanitary conditions and inadequate testing, were reported by former employees and regulators. These allegations were denied by Abbott Nutrition, but the plant's shutdown and recall of formula products contributed significantly to the shortage.

##Import restrictions

Import restrictions on infant formula from other countries, including Canada and Europe, limited the availability of formula in the United States. These restrictions, including tariffs and regulatory requirements, made it difficult for foreign manufacturers to export formula to the United States.

##Market concentration

The infant formula market in the United States is highly concentrated, with only a few major manufacturers, including Abbott Nutrition, Nestle, and Reckitt Benckiser. This market concentration can make the market more vulnerable to disruptions and shortages.

#Effects

The 2022 United States infant formula shortage had significant effects on families and caregivers of infants, including increased prices, reduced availability, and alternative feeding methods.

##Sale and donation of breast milk

The shortage led to an increase in the sale and donation of breast milk, as some families turned to this alternative source of nutrition for their infants. Online marketplaces and social media groups were used to facilitate the sale and donation of breast milk.

##Use of alternative foods

Some families turned to alternative foods, including cow's milk and solid foods, to feed their infants. These alternatives are not recommended for infants under six months old, and their use can pose health risks.

##Hospitalizations

The shortage led to an increase in hospitalizations of infants due to dehydration and malnutrition. In some cases, infants were hospitalized due to the use of alternative foods or contaminated formula.

##Bot usage

The shortage led to an increase in the use of bots and automated software to purchase formula online, exacerbating the shortage and driving up prices.

##Shortage in Canada

The shortage in the United States also affected Canada, where some families rely on imports of formula from the United States. The shortage led to reduced availability and increased prices in Canada.

#Responses

The 2022 United States infant formula shortage led to a range of responses from government agencies, manufacturers, and advocacy groups.

##Efforts to prevent price gouging

Efforts to prevent price gouging, including state and federal investigations, were launched to address concerns over price increases and profiteering.

##Efforts to increase supply

Efforts to increase supply, including the importation of formula from other countries and the production of formula at other plants, were launched to address the shortage.

##Efforts to restore production

Efforts to restore production at the Abbott Nutrition plant in Sturgis, Michigan, including a consent decree with the FDA, were launched to address concerns over safety and contamination.

##Investigations

Several investigations were launched into the causes and effects of the shortage, including congressional, FDA, ABC News, and DOJ investigations.

###Congressional investigation

A congressional investigation was launched to examine the causes and effects of the shortage, including the role of manufacturers and regulators.

###FDA investigation

An FDA investigation was launched to examine the safety and contamination concerns at the Abbott Nutrition plant in Sturgis, Michigan.

###ABC News investigation

An ABC News investigation was launched to examine the allegations of unsanitary conditions and inadequate testing at the Abbott Nutrition plant in Sturgis, Michigan.

###DOJ investigation

A DOJ investigation was launched to examine concerns over price gouging and profiteering during the shortage.

#Commentary

The 2022 United States infant formula shortage led to a range of commentary and criticism, including debates over breast milk vs. formula and criticism of the federal response.

##Breast milk vs. formula debate

The shortage led to a renewed debate over breast milk vs. formula, with some advocates arguing that breast milk is the best source of nutrition for infants and others arguing that formula is a necessary and safe alternative.

##Criticism of federal response

The federal response to the shortage was criticized by some advocates and lawmakers, who argued that the government did not do enough to address the shortage and support families affected by it.

###White House response

The White House response to the shortage was criticized by some advocates and lawmakers, who argued that the administration did not do enough to address the shortage and support families affected by it.

###Formula availability at the Southern border

The availability of formula at the Southern border was criticized by some lawmakers, who argued that the government was prioritizing the needs of migrants over the needs of American families.

Nigerien Crisis (2023–2024)

The Nigerien crisis is an ongoing political and security crisis that began in July 2023, following a military coup in Niger. The crisis has led to a significant deterioration in the country's security situation, with widespread protests, violence, and a humanitarian crisis.

# Background

## ECOWAS

The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) has played a significant role in the crisis. The regional bloc has imposed sanctions on Niger and has called for the restoration of democratic order in the country. ECOWAS has also threatened to use military force to intervene in the crisis if necessary.

## Security Situation

The security situation in Niger has deteriorated significantly since the coup. There have been reports of widespread violence, including attacks on civilians, security forces, and international organizations. The crisis has also led to a significant increase in the number of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and refugees fleeing to neighboring countries.

# Timeline

## July

### 29 July

A military coup took place in Niger, with a group of soldiers seizing power and announcing the suspension of the country's constitution. The coup leaders, who called themselves the National Council for the Safeguard of the Homeland (CNSP), announced that they had taken power due to the government's failure to address the country's security and economic crises.

### 30 July

#### ECOWAS Ultimatum and Sanctions

ECOWAS issued an ultimatum to the CNSP, calling for the restoration of democratic order in Niger within a week. The regional bloc also imposed sanctions on Niger, including the closure of borders and the suspension of trade and economic activities.

#### Pro-coup Demonstrations in Niamey

Thousands of people took to the streets in Niamey, the capital city of Niger, to demonstrate in support of the coup. The protesters, who were mostly young people, called for the CNSP to remain in power and for an end to the country's economic and security crises.

### 31 July

The CNSP announced that it had begun a process of national dialogue, aimed at resolving the country's crises and establishing a new government. The dialogue process was expected to involve representatives from various sectors of society, including political parties, civil society organizations, and trade unions.

2022 FIBA Asia Cup

The 2022 FIBA Asia Cup was the 30th edition of the FIBA Asia Cup, the top international basketball tournament in Asia. The tournament was held in Jakarta, Indonesia from July 12 to 24, 2022.

# Host selection

In 2018, FIBA Asia announced that Indonesia would host the 2022 FIBA Asia Cup. This marked the second time Indonesia has hosted the tournament, after the 1993 edition.

# Venue

The tournament was held at the Istora Gelora Bung Karno in Jakarta, Indonesia. The venue has a seating capacity of 7,166 and has hosted several international basketball tournaments in the past.

# Format

The tournament featured 16 teams, divided into four groups of four teams each. The top two teams from each group advanced to the final round, while the bottom two teams were eliminated. The final round featured a single-elimination bracket, with the quarterfinals, semifinals, and final.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2022 FIBA Asia Cup began in 2020. Teams qualified through a combination of their performance in the 2019 FIBA World Cup Asian Qualifiers and the 2020 FIBA Asia Cup Pre-Qualifiers.

## Qualified teams

The following 16 teams qualified for the 2022 FIBA Asia Cup:

* Australia
* China
* Chinese Taipei
* Hong Kong
* India
* Indonesia
* Iran
* Iraq
* Japan
* Jordan
* Kazakhstan
* Lebanon
* New Zealand
* Philippines
* Qatar
* South Korea

# Draw

The draw for the 2022 FIBA Asia Cup took place on June 18, 2022. The 16 teams were divided into four groups of four teams each.

## Seeding

The teams were seeded based on their FIBA World Rankings. The top four teams in the rankings were seeded into each group, while the remaining teams were drawn randomly.

# Squads

Each team was allowed to bring a maximum of 12 players to the tournament. The squads were announced by each team in the days leading up to the tournament.

# Group A

Group A consisted of Australia, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, and Indonesia.

## Australia

Australia was led by head coach Brian Goorjian. The team featured a mix of experienced players, including Nathan Sobey and Jesse Wagstaff.

## Jordan

Jordan was led by head coach Wesam Al-Sous. The team featured a young core of players, including Zaid Abbas and Freddy Ibrahim.

## Saudi Arabia

Saudi Arabia was led by head coach Ali Alsanhani. The team featured a mix of experienced players, including Omar Al-Rubaye and Mohammed Al-Suwailem.

## Indonesia

Indonesia was led by head coach Miloš Pejić. The team featured a young core of players, including Andakara Prastawa and Abdul Gani.

# Group B

Group B consisted of China, Iraq, Philippines, and Qatar.

## China

China was led by head coach Du Feng. The team featured a mix of experienced players, including Yi Jianlian and Guo Ailun.

## Iraq

Iraq was led by head coach Aleksandar Trajković. The team featured a young core of players, including Ali Ismael and Omar Al-Azawi.

## Philippines

Philippines was led by head coach Tim Cone. The team featured a mix of experienced players, including June Mar Fajardo and Jayson Castro.

## Qatar

Qatar was led by head coach Wesam Al-Sous. The team featured a young core of players, including Faisal Abuissa and Abdulrahman Al-Muftah.

# Group C

Group C consisted of Kazakhstan, Lebanon, New Zealand, and South Korea.

## Kazakhstan

Kazakhstan was led by head coach Renatas Kurilionokas. The team featured a mix of experienced players, including Rustam Murzagaliyev and Anton Ponomarev.

## Lebanon

Lebanon was led by head coach Jad El-Murr. The team featured a young core of players, including Wael Arakji and Ali Mezher.

## New Zealand

New Zealand was led by head coach Pero Cameron. The team featured a mix of experienced players, including Kirk Penney and Tom Abercrombie.

## South Korea

South Korea was led by head coach Choo Il-seung. The team featured a young core of players, including Heo Hoon and Kim Sun-hyung.

# Group D

Group D consisted of Bahrain, Chinese Taipei, Hong Kong, and Japan.

## Bahrain

Bahrain was led by head coach Mario Palma. The team featured a mix of experienced players, including Ahmed Ismael and C.J. Giles.

## Chinese Taipei

Chinese Taipei was led by head coach Charles Parker. The team featured a young core of players, including Liu Cheng and Kuo Hung-yi.

## Hong Kong

Hong Kong was led by head coach On Hing-kin. The team featured a mix of experienced players, including Duncan Reid and Wen Wei.

## Japan

Japan was led by head coach Julio Lamas. The team featured a mix of experienced players, including Rui Hachimura and Yuta Watanabe.

# Preliminary round

The preliminary round was played from July 12 to 17, 2022. The top two teams from each group advanced to the final round, while the bottom two teams were eliminated.

## Group A

Australia won Group A with a 3-0 record, followed by Jordan with a 2-1 record.

## Group B

China won Group B with a 3-0 record, followed by Philippines with a 2-1 record.

## Group C

Lebanon won Group C with a 3-0 record, followed by South Korea with a 2-1 record.

## Group D

Japan won Group D with a 3-0 record, followed by Chinese Taipei with a 2-1 record.

# Final round

The final round was played from July 18 to 24, 2022.

## Bracket

The final round featured a single-elimination bracket, with the quarterfinals, semifinals, and final.

## Playoffs

The playoffs were played from July 18 to 20, 2022. The quarterfinals were played on July 18, with Australia defeating Philippines 85-79, Lebanon defeating Chinese Taipei 97-79, South Korea defeating Jordan 93-85, and Japan defeating China 96-87.

## Quarterfinals

The quarterfinals were played on July 18, 2022.

## Semifinals

The semifinals were played on July 22, 2022. Australia defeated Lebanon 78-69, while Japan defeated South Korea 102-81.

## Third place game

The third place game was played on July 24, 2022. Lebanon defeated South Korea 84-74.

## Final

The final was played on July 24, 2022. Australia defeated Japan 75-73.

2022 Davis Cup Finals

The 2022 Davis Cup Finals was the 110th edition of the Davis Cup, a tournament between national teams in men's tennis. The event took place from November 22 to 27, 2022, at various locations around the world.

Participating teams
-----------------

### Overview

Sixteen teams participated in the 2022 Davis Cup Finals. The teams were divided into four groups of four teams each. The top two teams from each group advanced to the knockout stage.

### Seeds

The teams were seeded based on their performance in the previous edition of the Davis Cup. The top eight teams were seeded, while the remaining eight teams were unseeded.

Team nominations
----------------

### Group stage

#### Group A

* Argentina: Diego Schwartzman, Francisco Cerúndolo, Sebastián Báez, Andrés Molteni, Máximo González

The 2022 World Snooker Championship was a professional snooker tournament that took place from April 16 to May 2, 2022, at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, England. It was the 46th consecutive year the tournament was held at the venue and the 2022 edition marked the 94th staging of the World Snooker Championship.

#Background

##Format

The tournament was played over 17 days, with 32 players competing in the main draw. The top 16 players in the world rankings automatically qualified for the main stage, while the remaining 16 spots were filled by players who progressed through the qualifying rounds. The format of the tournament remained largely unchanged from previous years, with the main stage being played as a knockout competition, with each match being best of a certain number of frames.

###First round

The first round took place from April 16 to 20, 2022, and featured 32 players competing in a best-of-19 frames format. Notable results included defending champion Mark Selby's 10-7 victory over Jamie Jones, and former world champion John Higgins' 10-7 victory over Thepchaiya Un-Nooh.

###Quarter-finals

###Final

The final took place from April 30 to May 2, 2022, and featured Judd Trump and Ronnie O'Sullivan competing in a best-of-35 frames format. Ronnie O'Sullivan won the match 18-13, claiming his seventh World Snooker Championship title.

2022 Asian Women's Volleyball Cup

The 2022 Asian Women's Volleyball Cup was the sixth edition of the Asian Women's Volleyball Cup, a biennial international volleyball tournament organized by the Asian Volleyball Confederation (AVC) for the women's national teams of Asia. The tournament was held in Pasig, Philippines from August 21 to 29, 2022.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2022 Asian Women's Volleyball Cup was based on the team's performance at the 2018 Asian Games and the 2019 Asian Championship. The top six teams from the 2018 Asian Games and the top six teams from the 2019 Asian Championship qualified directly for the tournament. The remaining two teams were selected based on the AVC's continental ranking.

## Qualified teams

A total of eight teams qualified for the 2022 Asian Women's Volleyball Cup:

*  China
*  Japan
*  Thailand
*  South Korea
*  Vietnam
*  Chinese Taipei
*  Kazakhstan
*  Iran

# Pools composition

The eight qualified teams were divided into two pools of four teams each. The teams were seeded based on their performance at the 2018 Asian Games and the 2019 Asian Championship.

# Venue

The 2022 Asian Women's Volleyball Cup was held at the PhilSports Arena in Pasig, Philippines.

# Pool standing procedure

The standings of each pool were determined by the number of wins, with the following tiebreakers:

* Number of matches won
* Match points (3 points for a 3-0 or 3-1 win, 2 points for a 3-2 win, 1 point for a 2-3 loss, 0 points for a 0-3 or 1-3 loss)
* Sets quotient (total sets won divided by total sets lost)
* Points quotient (total points scored divided by total points conceded)

# Squads

Each team was allowed to register a maximum of 14 players for the tournament.

The preliminary round was played in a round-robin format, with each team playing the other teams in their pool once.

George Young (swimmer)

George Young was a Canadian long-distance swimmer who gained international recognition in the 1920s for his remarkable swimming achievements. Born in 1910, Young began his swimming career at a young age and quickly made a name for himself in the swimming world. This article provides an overview of Young's early swimming achievements, his notable swims, including the Catalina Channel swim, and his inconsistent swimming career.

#Early swimming achievements

Young began his swimming career as a teenager, training in the waters of Lake Ontario. He quickly demonstrated a natural talent for long-distance swimming, completing several notable swims in his early years. Young's early swimming achievements caught the attention of the swimming community, and he soon became known as one of the top young swimmers in Canada.

##Catalina swim training

In 1927, Young traveled to California to train for the Catalina Channel swim, a 21-mile swim that was considered one of the most challenging swims in the world at the time. Young spent several weeks training in the waters off Catalina Island, building up his endurance and acclimating to the cold water. His training paid off, and Young went on to complete the swim in record time.

#Catalina channel swim

On January 25, 1927, Young completed the Catalina Channel swim in a record time of 15 hours and 44 minutes. The swim was a significant achievement, and Young's time broke the previous record by over an hour. Young's success in the swim was widely recognized, and he became an overnight sensation in the swimming world.

##Swam with tides

Young's swim was notable not only for his record time but also for his strategy. He swam with the tides, using the currents to his advantage to complete the swim more quickly. Young's approach was innovative, and it helped him to conserve energy and complete the swim in record time.

##Competition from Norman Ross

Young's success in the Catalina Channel swim was not without competition. Norman Ross, an American swimmer, had also been training for the swim and was considered a top contender. However, Young's training and strategy paid off, and he was able to outswim Ross to set the new record.

##Public acclaim, with limited financial gain

Young's success in the Catalina Channel swim brought him widespread public acclaim, but it did not translate into significant financial gain. Despite his newfound fame, Young struggled to secure sponsorships and endorsements, and he was forced to rely on his own resources to fund his swimming career.

#Inconsistent swimming career

Young's swimming career was marked by inconsistency, with periods of great success followed by periods of struggle. Despite his early achievements, Young was unable to sustain a consistent level of performance, and his career was marked by ups and downs.

##1927, 21-Mile Lake Ontario swim

Central Riverina Football League

The Central Riverina Football League (CRFL) is an Australian rules football competition based in the Riverina region of New South Wales. The league was formed in 1949 and has a rich history of producing talented footballers and competitive matches. The CRFL is one of the strongest and most popular regional football leagues in New South Wales, with a loyal following and a reputation for exciting games.

# History

The Central Riverina Football League was formed in 1949, with five foundation clubs: Ariah Park-Mirrool, Barellan, Grong Grong-Matong, Narrandera, and Yanco. The league was established to provide a competitive and structured competition for football clubs in the Riverina region. Over the years, the CRFL has undergone several changes, including the addition of new clubs and the departure of others.

In the early years, the CRFL was dominated by the Ariah Park-Mirrool and Narrandera clubs, which won several premierships between them. However, other clubs such as Grong Grong-Matong and Yanco also had successful periods, winning premierships and producing talented players.

In recent years, the CRFL has continued to grow and develop, with the introduction of new initiatives and programs aimed at improving the competition and promoting football in the region. The league has also established strong relationships with other regional football leagues and governing bodies, ensuring that the CRFL remains a strong and competitive competition.

## Mergers and Changes

Over the years, the CRFL has undergone several mergers and changes, resulting in the current structure of the league. In 1974, the Ariah Park and Mirrool clubs merged to form the Ariah Park-Mirrool Football Club. In 1981, the Grong Grong and Matong clubs merged to form the Grong Grong-Matong Football Club.

In 1991, the Yanco Football Club was forced to withdraw from the competition due to financial difficulties. However, the club has since been re-established and currently competes in the CRFL.

## Notable Events

The CRFL has hosted several notable events over the years, including the 1985 NSW Country Football Championships, which were held in Narrandera. The championships featured teams from across New South Wales and were a major success for the league.

In 2011, the CRFL celebrated its 60th anniversary, with a series of events and matches held throughout the season. The anniversary was marked with a grand final replay between the Ariah Park-Mirrool and Narrandera clubs, with Ariah Park-Mirrool emerging victorious.

article:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987 TV series)

The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is an American animated television series created by Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird. The series is based on the comic book of the same name and follows the adventures of four anthropomorphic turtle brothers - Leonardo, Michelangelo, Donatello, and Raphael - who are trained in the art of ninjutsu and fight against evil forces in New York City.

# Series overview

## Seasons 1–7

The first seven seasons of the show, which aired from 1987 to 1993, were produced by Fred Wolf and consisted of 193 episodes. The series premiered on December 10, 1987, and was a huge success, running for five years in syndication. The show's popularity led to the creation of numerous merchandise, including toys, video games, and comic books.

During this period, the Turtles faced various villains, including the main antagonist, Shredder, who was the leader of the Foot Clan. Other notable villains included Krang, a brain-like alien who often allied with Shredder, and the Turtles' arch-nemesis, Slash, a mutated turtle who sought revenge against his former friends.

One notable episode from this period was "Vacation in Europe" (Season 4, Episode 13), in which the Turtles traveled to Europe to stop Shredder and Krang's plan to take over the world. The episode was a unique blend of action, humor, and cultural exploration, showcasing the Turtles' fish-out-of-water experiences in different European countries.

## Seasons 8–10

The final three seasons of the show, which aired from 1994 to 1996, were produced by David Wise and consisted of 72 episodes. During this period, the show's tone became darker and more serious, with more complex storylines and character development.

The Turtles faced new villains, including Lord Simultaneous, a powerful being who threatened the fabric of time and space, and the Turtles' own clone, who was created by Shredder to destroy the originals.

## Subsequent works

The success of the 1987 series led to the creation of numerous spin-offs, including a live-action film series, a new animated series in 2012, and various other media, including video games, comic books, and merchandise.

# Characters

## Overview

The characters in the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles universe are diverse and complex, with unique personalities, skills, and motivations.

## Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

The four main characters in the show are:

* Leonardo (voiced by Cam Clarke): The leader of the Turtles and the most skilled in ninjutsu.
* Michelangelo (voiced by Townsend Coleman): The most laid-back and fun-loving Turtle, who loves pizza and parties.
* Donatello (voiced by Barry Gordon): The genius inventor and engineer of the Turtles, who is responsible for creating many of their gadgets and vehicles.
* Raphael (voiced by Josh Pais): The hot-headed and aggressive Turtle, who often clashes with his brothers but ultimately fights for what is right.

## Allies and friends

The Turtles have many allies and friends, including:

* Splinter (voiced by Peter Renaday): The Turtles' sensei and father figure, who teaches them ninjutsu and guides them on their adventures.
* April O'Neil (voiced by Renae Jacobs): A human journalist who befriends the Turtles and often helps them on their missions.
* Casey Jones (voiced by Pat Fraley): A human vigilante who allies with the Turtles to fight against crime and injustice.

## Villains

### Main villains

The main villains in the show are:

* Shredder (voiced by James Avery): The leader of the Foot Clan and the Turtles' arch-nemesis.
* Krang (voiced by Pat Fraley): A brain-like alien who often allies with Shredder to take over the world.

### Recurring villains

Other notable villains include:

* Slash (voiced by Pat Fraley): A mutated turtle who seeks revenge against his former friends.
* Leatherhead (voiced by Jim Cummings): A mutated alligator who often clashes with the Turtles.
* Rocksteady (voiced by Cam Clarke) and Bebop (voiced by Barry Gordon): Two mutated animals who work for Shredder and often fight against the Turtles.

## Other characters

The show features many other characters, including allies, friends, and foes, who add to the richness and diversity of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles universe.

# Production

## Development and writing

The show was developed by Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird, who created the original comic book series. The show's writers included David Wise, Chris Pelzer, and Michael Reaves, among others.

## Voice acting

The show featured a talented cast of voice actors, including Cam Clarke, Townsend Coleman, Barry Gordon, and Josh Pais as the Turtles, as well as Peter Renaday, Renae Jacobs, and Pat Fraley as other notable characters.

# Soundtrack

The show's soundtrack was composed by Chuck Lorre and Dennis C. Brown, and featured a unique blend of rock, pop, and electronic music.

# Broadcast and release

## Syndication

The show was originally syndicated from 1987 to 1996, and was broadcast on various networks and stations around the world.

## International releases

The show was released in many countries, including the United Kingdom, Australia, Canada, and France, among others.

# Home video releases

## LaserDisc

## DVD

### Region 2

## Video on demand

article:
Cocaine Bear

Cocaine Bear is a 2023 American black comedy thriller film directed by Elizabeth Banks and written by Jimmy Warden. The film is loosely based on the true story of a 175-pound American black bear that died after ingesting a large quantity of cocaine in 1985. The film stars Keri Russell, O'Shea Jackson Jr., and Alden Ehrenreich, among others.

# Plot

The film takes place in 1985 and follows a group of characters whose lives become intertwined after a 175-pound American black bear ingests a large quantity of cocaine. The bear, which has been dropped onto a forest in Tennessee by a plane carrying a shipment of cocaine, begins to wreak havoc on the local community. A single mother, Sari (Keri Russell), her son, Dee (Christian Convery), and a detective, Bob (O'Shea Jackson Jr.), team up to track down the bear and prevent further destruction. Meanwhile, a group of smugglers, led by Syd (Alden Ehrenreich), try to recover the lost cocaine and eliminate anyone who gets in their way.

# Cast

* Keri Russell as Sari
* O'Shea Jackson Jr. as Detective Bob
* Alden Ehrenreich as Syd
* Christian Convery as Dee
* Brooklynn Prince as Katie
* Isiah Whitlock Jr. as Eddie
* Margo Martindale as Ranger Liz
* Ray Liotta as Syd's father

# Inspiration

The film is loosely based on the true story of a 175-pound American black bear that died after ingesting a large quantity of cocaine in 1985. The bear had been dropped onto a forest in Tennessee by a plane carrying a shipment of cocaine. The incident became notorious due to the unusual circumstances of the bear's death.

## Creative liberties

While the film is inspired by a true story, it takes significant creative liberties with the events. The film's writer, Jimmy Warden, has stated that he was more interested in exploring the characters and their relationships than in retelling the true story accurately. The film's director, Elizabeth Banks, has also stated that she wanted to use the true story as a starting point to explore themes of community, family, and redemption.

## Response to the film

The film's use of creative liberties has been met with some criticism from those who were involved in the original incident. However, the film's cast and crew have stated that they were not trying to make a documentary or a historically accurate retelling of the events, but rather a work of fiction inspired by the true story.

# Production

## Development and casting

The film was in development for several years before it was finally greenlit. The script was written by Jimmy Warden, and Elizabeth Banks was attached to direct. The cast was assembled over several months, with Keri Russell and O'Shea Jackson Jr. being the first to sign on. Alden Ehrenreich and Christian Convery were cast later, with Brooklynn Prince and Isiah Whitlock Jr. rounding out the supporting cast.

## Filming

Principal photography took place in the summer of 2022, with filming locations in North Carolina and Tennessee. The film's cinematographer, John Guleserian, used a combination of digital and film cameras to achieve a distinctive aesthetic. The film's editor, Joel Negron, worked closely with Banks to create a fast-paced and energetic editing style.

# Music

The film's score was composed by Mark Mothersbaugh, who is known for his work on films like "The Royal Tenenbaums" and "Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs". The score features a mix of electronic and orchestral elements, with a distinctive 80s vibe. The film's soundtrack also features several 80s hits, including songs by The Cure and Cyndi Lauper.

# Release

## Theatrical

The film was released in theaters on February 24, 2023, by Universal Pictures. The film opened in over 3,000 theaters in the United States and Canada, with a wide release in other countries following in the weeks and months that followed.

## Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on April 14, 2023, and on DVD and Blu-ray on May 9, 2023. The home media release includes several deleted scenes, a making-of documentary, and a commentary track by the film's director and cast.

# Reception

## Box office

The film was a moderate box office success, grossing over $120 million worldwide on a budget of $35 million. The film performed well in the United States, where it opened at number two at the box office, behind "Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania".

## Critical response

The film received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising its energetic and irreverent tone. The film holds a 74% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising the performances of the cast and the direction of Elizabeth Banks. However, some critics found the film's tone to be inconsistent and the plot to be predictable.

## Accolades

The film received several award nominations, including a Critics' Choice Movie Award nomination for Best Comedy. The film's cast and crew were also recognized with several festival awards, including the Grand Jury Prize at the SXSW Film Festival.

# Legacy

Cocaine Bear has been recognized as a cult classic, with many fans praising its unique blend of humor, action, and heart. The film's success has also led to a renewed interest in the true story that inspired it, with many people seeking out more information about the infamous bear.

article:
Acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk

The acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk refers to the series of events that led to the purchase of the social media platform Twitter by Elon Musk, the CEO of SpaceX and Tesla, Inc. The acquisition process began in April 2022 and concluded in October 2022.

# Prelude

## Background

Twitter, founded in 2006, had grown to become one of the largest social media platforms in the world, with over 440 million monthly active users. The company had faced various challenges in recent years, including declining user growth, increased competition from other social media platforms, and criticism over its content moderation policies.

## Early developments

In January 2022, Elon Musk began accumulating shares of Twitter, eventually becoming the company's largest shareholder. Musk had been an active user of the platform, using it to share updates about his companies and engage with his followers. His investment in Twitter sparked speculation about his intentions, with some analysts suggesting that he might attempt to acquire the company.

# Buyout offer

## Takeover bid

On April 14, 2022, Musk announced that he had submitted a bid to acquire Twitter for $43 billion. The offer, which valued Twitter at $54.20 per share, represented a 38% premium over the company's closing price on April 13. Musk stated that he wanted to acquire Twitter to promote free speech and reduce censorship on the platform.

## Acquisition announcement

On April 25, 2022, Twitter's board of directors accepted Musk's bid, and the company announced that it had agreed to be acquired by Musk. The acquisition was subject to approval by Twitter's shareholders and regulatory authorities.

# Attempted termination

## Alleged hold

In May 2022, Musk stated that he had put the acquisition on hold due to concerns over the number of fake accounts on Twitter. Musk claimed that Twitter had underreported the number of fake accounts, which he believed was a significant issue for the platform.

## Attempted withdrawal by Musk

On July 8, 2022, Musk announced that he was withdrawing from the acquisition agreement, citing Twitter's alleged failure to provide him with information about fake accounts. Twitter's board of directors responded by stating that it would take legal action to enforce the acquisition agreement.

# Revival and closing

## Revitalization of bid

On October 4, 2022, Musk revived his bid to acquire Twitter, offering to purchase the company at the original price of $54.20 per share. Twitter's board of directors accepted the offer, and the company announced that it had agreed to be acquired by Musk.

## Completion of purchase

On October 27, 2022, Musk completed the acquisition of Twitter, purchasing the company for $44 billion. Musk took over as CEO of Twitter, replacing Parag Agrawal, who had led the company since 2021.

## Post-acquisition

After acquiring Twitter, Musk announced plans to reform the platform's content moderation policies and reduce censorship. He also stated that he would allow former President Donald Trump to return to the platform, despite Trump's previous ban. Musk's acquisition of Twitter sparked widespread debate about the future of the platform and the implications of his ownership.

# Reactions

## Takeover bid

Musk's takeover bid was met with a mixed reaction from Twitter users and analysts. Some praised Musk's commitment to free speech and his willingness to challenge Twitter's content moderation policies. Others expressed concerns about Musk's ability to manage the platform and his potential to spread misinformation.

The acquisition announcement was met with a positive reaction from investors, with Twitter's stock price rising by 5% on the day of the announcement. However, some analysts expressed concerns about the potential risks of Musk's ownership, including the potential for decreased advertising revenue and increased competition from other social media platforms.

## Completion of purchase

# Critical analysis

## Takeover bid and acquisition announcement

Musk's takeover bid and acquisition announcement were widely seen as a significant development in the history of Twitter. The acquisition marked a major shift in the platform's ownership and raised questions about the future of the company. article:
Velma (TV series)
================

Velma is an American adult animated mystery comedy-drama television series created by Charlie Grandy for HBO Max. The series is a reboot of the Scooby-Doo franchise and serves as a prequel to the original series, focusing on the character of Velma Dinkley. The show premiered on January 12, 2023, and has received widespread critical acclaim for its unique blend of humor, mystery, and character development.

Plot
=====

The series follows the story of Velma Dinkley, a brilliant and analytical high school student who is obsessed with solving mysteries. Along with her friends Daphne Blake, Shaggy Rogers, and Fred Jones, Velma forms a group of amateur detectives who take on cases in their hometown of Coolsville. However, the show's focus is primarily on Velma, exploring her backstory, personality, and relationships with her friends and family.

Throughout the series, Velma and her friends encounter various mysteries, from supernatural entities to human villains. As they work together to solve these cases, Velma's analytical mind and sharp instincts are put to the test, often leading to humorous and unexpected outcomes. The show also delves into Velma's personal life, including her relationships with her parents, her struggles in school, and her passion for mystery novels.

Voice cast
==========

### Main

* Mindy Kaling as Velma Dinkley
* Glenn Howerton as Fred Jones
* Sam Richardson as Shaggy Rogers
* Constance Zimmer as Daphne Blake

### Supporting

* Russell Peters as Dinkley Sr.
* Melissa Fumero as Sophie
* Kathryn Hahn as Donna
* Ken Jeong as Mr. Lee
* Nicole Byer as Gina
* Wanda Sykes as Linda

Episodes
========

### Series overview

The first season of Velma consists of 10 episodes, released on January 12, 2023. The second season, also consisting of 10 episodes, is set to premiere in 2024. A special episode is also scheduled for release in 2024.

### Season 1 (2023)

10. "The Final Confrontation"

### Special (2024)

* "The Velma Holiday Mystery"

Production
==========

Velma is produced by Warner Bros. Animation and Kaling International, with Charlie Grandy serving as showrunner. The series is animated by Warner Bros. Animation, with a unique visual style that blends traditional animation with computer-generated imagery.

Release
=======

Velma premiered on January 12, 2023, on HBO Max, with new episodes released weekly. The show is also available to stream on various platforms, including Amazon Prime Video and Google Play.

Reception
==========

### Critical response

Velma has received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising its unique blend of humor, mystery, and character development. The show has been praised for its portrayal of Velma, with many noting that the character is more fleshed out and relatable than in previous iterations.

### Audience response

The show has also been well-received by audiences, with many praising its unique take on the Scooby-Doo franchise. The show's blend of humor, mystery, and heart has resonated with fans of all ages.

### In popular culture

Velma has been referenced in various forms of media, including TV shows, movies, and music. The show's unique visual style and characters have also been referenced in various memes and fan art.

article:
Boris Johnson

Alexander Boris de Pfeffel Johnson is a British politician who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from July 2019 to September 2022. He previously served as the Mayor of London from 2008 to 2016 and the Member of Parliament (MP) for Uxbridge and South Ruislip since 2015. Johnson is a prominent figure in the Conservative Party and has been a key advocate for Brexit.

# Early life and education

## Childhood

Boris Johnson was born on June 19, 1964, in New York City, USA, to Stanley Johnson and Charlotte Fawcett. His father was a British diplomat, and the family moved frequently during Johnson's childhood, spending time in the United States, Belgium, and the United Kingdom. Johnson's parents divorced when he was a child, and he was raised by his mother, who later remarried.

## Eton and Oxford: 1977–1987

Johnson attended Eton College, a prestigious independent boarding school in Berkshire, England, where he was a King's Scholar. He was an active member of the school's debating society and developed a passion for classical literature and history. After completing his secondary education, Johnson went on to study Classics at Balliol College, Oxford. At Oxford, Johnson was a member of the Bullingdon Club, an exclusive dining club known for its wealthy and influential members. He graduated with a 2:1 degree in 1987.

# Early career

## The Times and The Daily Telegraph: 1987–1994

After graduating from Oxford, Johnson began his career in journalism as a trainee reporter at The Times. However, he was sacked from the newspaper in 1988 for falsifying a quote. Johnson then moved to The Daily Telegraph, where he worked as a correspondent in Brussels, covering European Union affairs. During his time at The Daily Telegraph, Johnson developed a reputation for his Eurosceptic views and his writing style, which was often described as humorous and engaging.

## Political columnist: 1994–1999

In 1994, Johnson became the political columnist for The Spectator, a conservative magazine. He quickly established himself as a prominent voice in British conservatism, writing about politics, culture, and society. Johnson's columns often sparked controversy, and he became known for his provocative and contrarian views.

## The Spectator and MP for Henley: 1999–2008

### Becoming an MP

In 1999, Johnson was appointed as the editor of The Spectator, a position he held until 2005. During his time as editor, Johnson continued to write columns and developed a reputation as a charismatic and witty commentator. In 2001, Johnson was elected as the Member of Parliament for Henley, a safe Conservative seat in Oxfordshire. He held the seat until 2008, when he resigned to focus on his mayoral campaign.

### Second term

Johnson was re-elected as MP for Henley in 2005, increasing his majority in the process. During his second term, Johnson continued to write columns and appeared regularly on television and radio, cementing his status as a prominent media personality.

# Mayor of London (2008–2016)

## Mayoral election: 2007–2008

In 2007, Johnson announced his candidacy for the Mayor of London, challenging the incumbent Ken Livingstone. Johnson's campaign focused on issues such as crime, transport, and the economy, and he promised to bring a fresh perspective to the role. Johnson won the election in May 2008, defeating Livingstone by a margin of 53% to 47%.

## First term: 2008–2012

### Policies

During his first term, Johnson implemented a number of policies aimed at improving the quality of life in London. He introduced a bike-sharing scheme, expanded the city's congestion charge, and invested in public transport. Johnson also focused on reducing crime, particularly knife crime, and introduced a number of initiatives aimed at supporting young people.

### Relations with the police, finance, and the media

Johnson's relationship with the police was often tense, particularly during the 2011 London riots. He was criticized for his handling of the crisis, and his decision to cut police numbers was widely opposed. Johnson's relationship with the media was also strained, particularly with The Guardian, which he accused of being biased against him.

### Re-election campaign

In 2012, Johnson announced his candidacy for re-election as Mayor of London. His campaign focused on his record in office, particularly his achievements in reducing crime and improving transport. Johnson won the election in May 2012, defeating Ken Livingstone by a margin of 52% to 48%.

## Second term: 2012–2016

During his second term, Johnson continued to implement his policies, particularly in the areas of transport and housing. He also focused on promoting London as a global city, hosting a number of high-profile events, including the 2012 Summer Olympics.

# Return to Parliament

## Brexit campaign: 2015–2016

In 2015, Johnson announced his support for the Leave campaign in the EU referendum. He became a prominent figure in the campaign, writing columns and appearing on television and radio. Johnson's decision to support Leave was seen as a significant boost to the campaign, and he played a key role in the eventual victory.

## Foreign Secretary: 2016–2018

In July 2016, Johnson was appointed as the Foreign Secretary by Prime Minister Theresa May. Johnson's appointment was seen as a surprise, particularly given his lack of experience in foreign affairs. During his time as Foreign Secretary, Johnson was criticized for his handling of a number of high-profile crises, including the Libyan civil war and the Rohingya crisis.

## Return to the backbenches: 2018–2019

### Journalism

In July 2018, Johnson resigned as Foreign Secretary, citing his opposition to Theresa May's Brexit strategy. He returned to the backbenches, where he wrote columns and appeared regularly on television and radio. Johnson's writing often sparked controversy, particularly his comments on Islam and women.

### 2019 Conservative Party leadership election

In May 2019, Johnson announced his candidacy for the Conservative Party leadership, challenging Theresa May's successor. Johnson's campaign focused on his support for Brexit and his commitment to delivering a no-deal exit from the EU. Johnson won the election in July 2019, becoming the new Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

# Premiership (2019–2022)

## First term (July–December 2019)

### Brexit policy

During his first term, Johnson's Brexit policy dominated the agenda. He promised to deliver a no-deal exit from the EU, but eventually negotiated a revised withdrawal agreement with Brussels. Johnson's decision to prorogue Parliament was widely criticized, and he faced a number of challenges in the courts.

### First Cabinet

Johnson's first Cabinet was notable for the number of new appointments, particularly in the areas of Brexit and foreign policy. He appointed a number of experienced politicians, including Dominic Raab and Priti Patel.

### Loss of working majority

In September 2019, Johnson lost his working majority in the House of Commons, following the defection of a number of Conservative MPs. Johnson's decision to expel the rebels from the party was widely criticized.

### 2019 general election

In December 2019, Johnson called a general election, seeking to secure a majority in the House of Commons. Johnson's campaign focused on his Brexit policy and his commitment to delivering a no-deal exit from the EU. Johnson won the election, securing a majority of 80 seats.

## Second term (December 2019 – September 2022)

### Second Cabinet

Johnson's second Cabinet was notable for the number of reshuffles, particularly in the areas of education and health. He appointed a number of new ministers, including Gavin Williamson and Matt Hancock.

### COVID-19 pandemic

During the COVID-19 pandemic, Johnson's government was criticized for its handling of the crisis. Johnson's decision to introduce lockdown measures was widely opposed, and his government's record on vaccination and testing was criticized.

### Immigration

Johnson's immigration policy dominated the agenda, particularly in the areas of asylum and refugee policy. He introduced a number of new measures, including the points-based system.

### Legislative agenda

article:
Edson Arantes do Nascimento, known as Pelé, was a Brazilian professional footballer who is widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time. Born on October 23, 1940, in Três Corações, Brazil, Pelé's impact on the sport extends far beyond his impressive playing career, with his legacy continuing to inspire and influence generations of footballers and fans alike.

# Early years

Pelé grew up in a poor household in Três Corações, where he developed a passion for football at an early age. He began playing with his friends in the streets, using makeshift balls made of bundled up socks or rags. His father, João Ramos do Nascimento, a former footballer himself, encouraged Pelé's love for the sport and helped him develop his skills. Pelé's talent was evident from a young age, and he quickly rose through the ranks of local youth teams.

# Club career

## Santos

Pelé joined Santos FC at the age of 15 and quickly established himself as a key player for the club. During his 18-year tenure with Santos, Pelé won numerous titles, including three Copa Libertadores trophies, and became a national hero in Brazil.

### 1956–1962: early years with Santos and declared a national treasure

Pelé's professional debut came in 1956, when he scored four goals in a 7-1 victory over Corinthians. His impressive performances earned him a call-up to the Brazilian national team, and he made his international debut in 1957. In 1961, Pelé was declared a national treasure by the Brazilian government, making it impossible for him to be sold to a foreign club.

### 1962–1965: Copa Libertadores success

Santos won their first Copa Libertadores title in 1962, with Pelé scoring two goals in the final against Boca Juniors. The team repeated this success in 1963, defeating Boca Juniors once again in the final. Pelé's impressive performances in the Copa Libertadores earned him the nickname "O Rei" (The King).

### 1965–1974: O Milésimo and final years with Santos

In 1969, Pelé scored his 1,000th goal, known as "O Milésimo," in a match against Vasco da Gama. This milestone cemented his status as one of the greatest players of all time. Pelé continued to play for Santos until 1974, when he retired from Brazilian club football.

## Tours with Santos

During the 1960s, Santos embarked on several international tours, which helped to spread Pelé's fame and establish him as a global football icon. These tours took Santos to Europe, Africa, and Asia, where they played against top teams from around the world.

## New York Cosmos

In 1975, Pelé came out of retirement to play for the New York Cosmos in the North American Soccer League (NASL). He played for the Cosmos from 1975 to 1977, helping the team win the NASL championship in 1977.

# International career

Pelé's international career spanned 14 years, during which he won three World Cup titles and scored 77 goals in 92 appearances.

## 1958 World Cup

Pelé made his World Cup debut in 1958, scoring six goals in the tournament, including two in the final against Sweden. Brazil won the tournament, and Pelé was hailed as a national hero.

## 1959 South American Championship

Pelé played in the 1959 South American Championship, where Brazil finished second to Argentina.

## 1962 World Cup

Brazil won the 1962 World Cup, but Pelé was injured in the second match and played no further part in the tournament.

## 1966 World Cup

Pelé played in the 1966 World Cup, but Brazil was eliminated in the group stage.

## 1970 World Cup

Pelé played in his final World Cup in 1970, where Brazil won the tournament, defeating Italy 4-1 in the final.

# Style of play

Pelé was a versatile player who could play in a variety of positions, including forward, midfielder, and defender. He was known for his exceptional speed, skill, and scoring ability, earning him the nickname "The King."

# Legacy

Pelé's legacy extends far beyond his playing career. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time, and his influence on the sport continues to be felt today.

## Accolades

Pelé has received numerous accolades, including three World Cup titles, two Copa Libertadores trophies, and numerous individual awards.

## "Pelé Pact" and Puma sponsorship

In 1977, Pelé signed a sponsorship deal with Puma, which became known as the "Pelé Pact." This deal helped to establish Puma as a major player in the football industry.

# Personal life

## Relationships and children

Pelé has been married three times and has seven children. His first marriage was to Rosemeri dos Reis Cholbi, with whom he had two daughters.

## Politics

Pelé has been involved in politics, and in 1994, he was appointed as the Minister of Sports in Brazil.

## Religion

Pelé is a devout Catholic and has spoken publicly about the importance of his faith.

## Health

Pelé has suffered from various health issues, including hip replacements and colon cancer.

# After football

After retiring from football, Pelé went on to become a successful businessman and entrepreneur. He has invested in various ventures, including a sports equipment company and a chain of restaurants.

# Death and funeral

Pelé passed away on December 29, 2022, at the age of 82, after a long battle with colon cancer. His funeral was held in Santos, Brazil, and was attended by thousands of mourners.

article:
Avatar: The Way of Water
=========================

Avatar: The Way of Water is a 2022 American epic science fiction film directed by James Cameron and produced by 20th Century Studios. It is the long-awaited sequel to the 2009 film Avatar, which became the highest-grossing film of all time upon its release. The Way of Water continues the story of Jake Sully, a paraplegic marine who becomes the leader of the Na'vi people on the planet Pandora.

Plot
-----

The film takes place 13 years after the events of the first film. Jake Sully (Sam Worthington) and Neytiri (Zoe Saldana) have formed a family, with two sons, Neteyam (Jamie Flatters) and Lo'ak (Britain Dalton), and an adopted daughter, Tuktirey (Trinity Bliss). However, their peaceful life is disrupted by the return of human colonizers, led by Colonel Miles Quaritch (Stephen Lang), who seeks revenge against Jake for his role in the Na'vi's victory in the first film.

As the conflict escalates, Jake and his family are forced to flee their home and seek refuge with the Metkayina, a tribe of Na'vi who live in harmony with the ocean. The Metkayina are led by Tonowari (Cliff Curtis) and his wife, Ronal (Kate Winslet), who become allies to Jake and his family.

As the story unfolds, Jake and his family must navigate the dangers of the ocean and confront their own personal demons in order to protect their home and their way of life. Along the way, they discover new wonders and secrets about the planet Pandora and the Na'vi people.

Cast
-----

* Sam Worthington as Jake Sully
* Zoe Saldana as Neytiri
* Sigourney Weaver as Kiri
* Stephen Lang as Colonel Miles Quaritch
* Cliff Curtis as Tonowari
* Kate Winslet as Ronal
* Jamie Flatters as Neteyam
* Britain Dalton as Lo'ak
* Trinity Bliss as Tuktirey
* Jack Champion as Spider

Themes and Analysis
--------------------

Avatar: The Way of Water explores several themes that are central to the Avatar franchise. One of the primary themes is the clash between technology and nature. The human colonizers, led by Colonel Quaritch, represent the destructive power of technology, while the Na'vi people, led by Jake and Neytiri, represent a deep connection to the natural world.

The film also explores the theme of identity and belonging. Jake, who was once a human, has become a part of the Na'vi people, but he still struggles with his own identity. His sons, Neteyam and Lo'ak, also struggle with their own identities, as they navigate their mixed heritage.

The film also explores the theme of community and family. The Na'vi people are a tight-knit community that is based on a deep sense of connection and respect for one another. Jake and his family are at the center of this community, and their relationships with one another are a key part of the story.

Production
------------

### Development

James Cameron had been planning to make a sequel to Avatar since the release of the first film in 2009. However, the development process was slow, and the film was not officially announced until 2017. Cameron spent several years working on the script and developing the technology that would be needed to bring the film to life.

### Writing

Cameron wrote the script for The Way of Water with Laeta Kalogridis and Josh Friedman. The script was based on a story that Cameron had developed with a team of writers, including Amanda Silver and Rick Jaffa.

### Casting

The cast of The Way of Water includes several actors who returned from the first film, including Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, and Sigourney Weaver. The film also features several new cast members, including Kate Winslet, Cliff Curtis, and Jack Champion.

### Filming

#### Performance Capture

The performance capture process for The Way of Water was similar to the process used for the first film. The actors performed in a large volume, with cameras capturing their movements from multiple angles. The data from the cameras was then used to create the characters' movements and performances in the film.

#### Live-Action

The live-action portions of the film were shot on location in New Zealand and in a large tank at Stone Street Studios in Wellington. The tank was used to shoot the scenes that take place underwater, and it was filled with a large amount of water and equipped with a system for creating waves and currents.

### Visual Effects

The visual effects for The Way of Water were created by Weta Digital, a company that is based in Wellington, New Zealand. The company used a combination of techniques, including motion capture, keyframe animation, and simulation, to create the characters, environments, and effects in the film.

### Runtime

The runtime of The Way of Water is 192 minutes, making it one of the longest films of the year.

Music
------

The score for The Way of Water was composed by Simon Franglen, who worked with James Cameron to develop the music for the film. The score features a combination of orchestral and choral elements, and it was recorded with a large orchestra and choir.

Marketing
----------

The marketing campaign for The Way of Water was launched in the spring of 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer that featured footage from the film. The trailer was a major success, and it helped to generate buzz and excitement for the film.

Release
--------

The Way of Water was released in theaters on December 16, 2022. The film was released in a variety of formats, including IMAX, Dolby Cinema, and 3D.

### Home Media

The Way of Water was released on home media in the spring of 2023. The film was available on DVD, Blu-ray, and digital platforms, and it featured a number of bonus features, including deleted scenes and behind-the-scenes footage.

Reception
----------

### Box Office

#### United States and Canada

The Way of Water was a major success at the box office in the United States and Canada. The film opened at number one, with a weekend gross of $134 million. It went on to gross over $600 million in the United States and Canada, making it one of the highest-grossing films of the year.

#### China

The Way of Water was also a success in China, where it grossed over $100 million. The film was released in a number of formats, including IMAX and 3D, and it was a major hit with Chinese audiences.

#### Other Territories

The Way of Water was also successful in other territories, including Europe, Asia, and Latin America. The film grossed over $1 billion worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of the year.

### Critical Response

The Way of Water received positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's visuals, action sequences, and performances. The film holds a 76% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 422 reviews.

### Accolades

The Way of Water was nominated for several awards, including four Academy Awards. The film won several awards, including the Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Visual Effects.

Sequels
----------

James Cameron has announced plans to make several more sequels to Avatar, with the next film scheduled for release in 2025. The sequels will continue the story of Jake and the Na'vi people, and they will feature many of the same characters and themes as the first two films.

2023 NHL Entry Draft

The 2023 NHL Entry Draft was the 61st NHL Entry Draft, held on June 28-29, 2023, at the Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, Tennessee. The draft was the first to be held in Nashville, and it marked a return to a traditional in-person format after two years of virtual drafts due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

# Eligibility

The eligibility criteria for the 2023 NHL Entry Draft were the same as in previous years. Players born between January 1, 2003, and September 15, 2005, were eligible for selection. Additionally, players who were not drafted in the 2021 NHL Entry Draft and were born after June 30, 2003, were also eligible.

# Draft lottery

The 2023 NHL Draft Lottery was held on May 8, 2023, to determine the top three picks in the draft. The Chicago Blackhawks won the first overall pick, followed by the Anaheim Ducks and the Columbus Blue Jackets. The lottery was conducted using a weighted system, with the teams that missed the playoffs having a higher chance of winning one of the top three picks.
